description:
This neighborhood restaurant is a block from where I grew up and where my family still lives although I have only been here a couple of times. 
 As a test to give a gift certificate for some really great neighbor's, I took my Mom to Marcello's the other night to make sure if we were giving a gift certificate to a meal that it was a good experience.
We arrived early and they seated us right away.  The place filled up yet we never felt rushed or that the service was lacking.  We ordered the dinner, salad/ minestrone soup.  The salad was cold, crisp and fresh.  The soup was traditional and very good. The pasta also was fresh, perfectly cooked and arrived hot.  We had to wait a bit for my entree as it took longer, however our waiter let us know that it would take a little longer,  I appreciated that he checked in and let us know. 
I ordered the Pollo Ai Fierri.  Both dishes arrived at the same time, hot and frankly it was the best roasted chicken I have had in a restaurant. It was moist, perfectly cooked and hot.  (I have a thing about my food arriving hot in a restaurant - so many times it arrives lukewarm) My mom had the Chicken Dore (similar to Chicken Milanese)  - she absolutely loved it;  she can be hard to please.  All in All a great experience. We bought the gift certificate. This is now one of my very favorite Italian restaurant's.
author: Janet C.

description: Food was tasty and hot. Service was terrible. Had to request water, literally, 4 times. Appetizer came out before water/beverages. We brought a cake for my Moms bday and had to ask for it at the end of the meal. Not a particularly young clientele or employees. We were there for almost 2 hours and didn't order anything particularly special. Just. Took. Forever. And ever.
author: Jess P.

description: As a sunset native I've driven past this place hundreds of times since I was a baby & never gave it much thought. It's an old school gem & I'm glad my partner suggested it. The staff is friendly & efficient. The pesto gnocchi was tasty, with a generous portion & will make for a nice leftover. I look forward to coming back to try more of their dishes (I had a hard time deciding what to order since everything looked so good).
author: Gena G.

description:
I guess they get points for being a staple of the neighborhood.  
But we had a group of 7 last night for dinner and didn't have anything else great to say here.  
On check in they didn't have the group table ready.  Then once seated it took 20 minutes plus the involvement of the owner to get water and bread.  Then it took another 60 minutes to get the main course out.  At no time did they offer to bring the mains for the kids out early even though some adults got the salad menu option. We ended up there over 2.5 hours and other that that first time they set the water down it was not until 2.25 hours into our meal that we got the water refilled.  Wait staff stopped by exactly 3 times in that timeframe.  All in all TERRIBLE service. Food was okay but not special. All the servings were different sizes of food -- 2 dishes of gnocchi for example were 25% different in quantity.  You go here if you have fond memories of some dish long ago I guess.  Or you want an instagram photo in front for the 1950s era bar kitsch.  But for a nice meal with a family I think you search a new place.
author: Brad R.

description:
Years. More than I can count. Years I've been coming here to Marcello's. One of these old-timely Italian places been around forever. White table cloths, crusty bread and pats of butter waiting for you and no they don't charge for the friggin bread!
I've tried most everything and they're known for their tender succulent veal dishes, but I always get the eggplant parmesan. 

Stop the eye-roll  please. I'm not dieting nor vegan. It's simply the best anywhere. And I mean anywhere. Thick slices not breaded, ethereally light and coated with both a tomato sauce and a gentle addition of béchamel. You cannot see this white luscious sauce but it's there adding unctuous goodness to this sublime vegetable. There are always a nice portion of sliced potato Anna and a vibrant green vegetable that accompany it all. 
Doesn't matter what you get. It's all so very del ious. Really. I'm not sure I've ever had a bad meal there. Or even an uh meal. I've enjoyed birthdays, engagements, during the week meals there-you name it-and have always been delighted. 

So we get the meal here. That means a little plate of rigatoni w meat sauce to start then this salad with an Italian vegetable dressing. I've told my family to tel them I'm dying and my last request was for this salad dressing recipe. When gourmet magazine had a section called "you asked for it" I was hoping I'd get it then. Yes it's that good!! I've already been back in the kitchen to learn how to make the eggplant. (And still cannot replicate it!)

It's way over on that side of town. Nothing chic nearby. Doesn't matter. Or shouldn't. Before Marcelo the owner runs away porcini hunting again please go. Indulge in this delicious reasonably priced Italian food.  

I feel lucky to have this as part of my history. So many memories have been made there. All good. All.
author: Peddie A.

description: Great old school Italian restaurant in our neighborhood. My grandparents used to go here all the time, hope this place never changes. Good food, stiff drinks, reasonable prices, and great service. What's not to like?
author: Meesh S.

description:
Our party of four yearned for an SF traditional Italian meal. Salmon, rack of lamb and two veal with fresh porcini mushrooms filled the bill for us. We ordered the dinner which provided a salad with house dressing (very good), a pasta serving with delicious red sauce, and a dessert of choice. There are so many delicious choices on the menu that make one want to order more (don't --- the portions are more than adequate).

The service was impeccable and the pace of dinner was leisurely. Five stars! Only downside: parking is a challenge.
author: Ray C.

description:
Sooo important to have places like this since they are a dying breed.Authentic and very old school place that is VERY retro,liked faded formal elegance 
Food is well prepared nothing fancy-what really is amazing are the prices which are some of the best in the city for this kind of food....tasty veal dishes and pasta plus things like escargot!! Crusty old waiters add to the charm!! Marcelo the man and this restaurant is an institution let us hope I it stays open for another 40 years.....
author: james m.

description:
Love Marchellos been coming here for years food is family style Italian staff are the best 
Try it eveyone
author: wayne b.

description: It was so crowded on a Friday and the place had an old feel to it. There were mainly old, loud, white folks in there, with a few young couples. On the brighter side, our waiter was really kind and funny. The food was OK; I wouldn't come back as this didn't fit the bill for me at all.
author: Steph L.

description: I love Marcello's! My family and I have been coming here since I was a kid. The atmosphere is old school, Italian, and San Francisco. As you are served by waiters in tuxedos, you can feel the rumble of the street cars on the Taraval line, and witness the owner Marcello chop it up with friendly patrons at the bar. I love their Cesar salad, fettuccine bolognese, and chicken parm! Marcello's is a San Francisco icon that I think is worth trying at the least. Who knows, maybe it will become a family spot for you too
author: Billy T.

description: Thursday night was the second time I've eaten there. This is another restaurant from the 1950s that's still around. There's no wait-time here. Customers are seated the moment they step in.
author: Julio B.

description:
It was ok. 

I suppose I didn't have very high expectations going in, so by my normal standard it would probably get three stars, but I feel like they were trying to be nicer than they turned out, so, I'm going low.

The inside is nice enough.  Mirrors on the walls so it looks bright. Seemed clean.

It was surprisingly busy in my opinion on a Tuesday night.

The wine menu was hilarious.  For wines by the glass, they has a number listed, House Red, a Sangiovese - which did have a a name, a Chianit, a Cab Sav, a Merlot, a Pinot Noir, and a Zinfandel.  No explanation of where any of those wines came from or who made them, or the year... classy.

The house salad was very mediocre.  It has celery and carrots in it, which is never a good sign.  reminded me of a diner salad

My veal raviolis were fine. They tasted like ravioli. Definitely not anything to write home about. 

My husband's veal with mushrooms was also fine. Tasted like food. The mushrooms were probably the best part. 

I did like our waiter.  He was a nice, helpful guy.
author: Sarah C.

description: Marcello's is a wonderful gem on Taraval Street!  The touch of class and elegance this restaurant provides is greatly appreciated.  The food is superb and the staff is very friendly, professional, and dressed very smart!  Always a favorite spot!
author: Debra D.

description: The pastor was good there was good service we all gave the pesto a 10 I wold recamend to eat here
author: Anthony U.

description: Very friendly waiters / waitress. The English Sole is my family's favorite, every one loves it. We lived around the area for over 20yrs but didn't realize it existed.
author: E C.

description:
Outstanding experience!
Veal..Chowder..even the Cappuccino  
Definately returning for more.
author: Rick V.

description:
Do not trust the good reviews. The food here is not good at all. I hate to say this because this looks like a nice neighborhood restaurant but it's one of the worst Italian food I've ever had. People that write good reviews obviously don't have very good taste and it's not surprising once you see who eats here. 

The veal and mushrooms were the only thing that tasted ok but the portions were so small. Bread taste old and butter had a freezer burn taste. Tortellini was hard and not flavorful. Clams were chewy. Minestrone soup had a funky taste to it. They give you like 5 penne pastas with the dinner set. Ok I'm exaggerating... it was maybe 10 pennes.  Other pasta dishes were equally bad. 

I'm giving an extra star because people working there were nice and friendly. Although the main waiter was kinda grumpy.
author: Gir G.

description: Have not been in several years, and decided to have an early Father's day dinner for my husband and father. We were greeted by an older women as I had a 5pm reservation which really didn't seem to matter and the restaurant was empty with 3 people sitting at the bar. Our waitress was nice and you could sense she has worked there for quiet sometime, but lacked an order of how to waitress. We received menu's and as she overheard me asking my party about wanting escargot's she jumped in asking if she should put in an order to be fired up. I held her off until everyone had made a decision of what they wanted to start off there meal with. She returned and an order was placed for escargot's and carpaccio. She then returned to take our dinner order. Never once asking can I start you off with something to drink. Overlooking things being done kind of backwards the food arrived. The escargot's and carpaccio were excellent and thought we were off to a good start! Then salads arrived and just fell flat with excessive dressing (too much vinegar) on the house salads and a bed of lettuce with all the toppings looking like they had been flattened with a rolling pin made the salads look quiet unappealing. I had the Caesar's salad which should have been crisp and cold and the yellow portion of the romaine lettuce and it was just the opposite warm lettuce and all green which was bitter and just fell short of what should have been a great salad. The Pasta of the day arrived for my mother and husband who had ordered the complete dinners were handed a tasteless penne pasta in a bolognese sauce with a running water sauce. I had the cannelloni which I was told was stuffed with spinach, ricotta and veal and I searched every bite for spinach and ricotta and to great disapppointment never found and I then unrolled the cannelloni and really questioned if it was even veal. My son had the Gnocchi in cream sauce which lacked any taste and felt like the Gnocchi came out of a box. My father had the pepper steak which had a lack luster tasteless pepper sauce and a cut of steak for the price was overpriced! His potatoes were cold as was everyone's potatoes that accompanied their dinner's. My husband had the special which was veal with porcini mushroom's and not wanting to rock the boat at the time, but we got home said it was just terrible and tasteless and the plate really fell short with cold potatoes and green beans. We then ordered desserts to be again disappointed that they could only fill 3 out of the 4 orders of creme caramel because they had run out. Not really disappointed after tasting and sharing with my son as the creme caramel tasted old and flat in appearance and size. Who runs out of dessert going into a start of weekend with celebrations for Father's Day?? The Tiramisu however was excellent!! Fresh as if had just been made. It was unanimous among all of us that this would not be a return restaurant on our list as it lacked presentation of dishes, taste and exceptional service for the prices they charge. Oh and by the way, when I told the waitress about the cannelloni which I specifically had asked her about before ordering responded "Oh, they must have changed it"! Too bad the price didn't change since it did not have the contents as you described. Not returning and extremely disappointed.....
author: Michelle W.

description:
Have you ever seen the movie ratatouille? Well that scene where the critic tastes the ratatouille and it takes him back to his childhood... Well that's this place!
As a kid growing up outside of New York City, my folks took me to this little Italian place that has been embedded in my mind for a lifetime. I feel like I found the place again at this restaurant. This is the quintessential old-school Italian restaurant. Liz, Laura are great as is the food ....go!!!
author: Mischa H.

description: Started with a great artichoke heart vinaigrette salad. Had one of my usual entree's of rack of lamb which they do very well on the dinner with their solid minestrone soup. Another great meal!
author: Dan W.

description: I hate to sound rude, but I really had a hard time dealing with the teasing that Patrick performed. That was a long time ago and I believe that this should be kept top secret. I'm going here with my parents tonight and we'd feel better having Tony as our waiter instead of Patrick whereas he's less likely to tease us in metaphor of Renato from The Olympic Club and my late great grandfather.
author: Andrea P.

description: Love this place! Outside looks like a dive bar but you walk in the door and wow! Old school Italian American food served in swank, time warp interior that blew my mind. Full bar made of big rocks is an added plus. Patrons are mostly older locals from the area. This joint is dripping with atmosphere including the old bus boy with his uniform or the owner who sits at a cute little desk with a mushroom lamp. Its been in business  45 years and you can tell since nothing has changed since the day it opened - in a good way. Nothing trendy or foodie here. You ain't gonna get organic or local. The wine list is a hoot but people bring their own wine. Reminds me of the restaurants I ate in as a kid in the 1970s and the menu is straight from that era. Yes this place isn't fancy or authentic Italian food. If you into vintage then you will appreciate this place. Its truly a time capsule and well worth the trip. Will go back for sure.
author: Thomas K.

description:
On a more recent visit I took my son and two young grandsons.  The waiter was very accommodating and suggested things that the youngsters would enjoy and could share.  Service and food were excellent.  I was also impressed by the waiter going above and beyond his duties to make it enjoyable.  He noticed my son was leaning over trying to watch the basketball game on the TV in the bar.  So he moved some things out of the way and opened a window between the bar and dining room so my son could get an unobstructed view!

Really pleased !
author: Bob S.

description:
We came in on a Friday around 7:30. No reservations, but was seated rather quickly. Ordered two pasta dishes and where given bread and butter. Bread was warm and tasty. 
Pasta was nothing to run home and write about. Good but just ok. Glass of Merlot. Good glass of wine . Tiramisu was on the tiny side but decent tasting.
author: Jesse S.

description:
I ate dinner here last night with a group of about 30-35 people. 

The food was ok but the attitude of the waiter left a LOT to be desired. The room is NOT set up for a larger group. The group, due to it's size, was split up. The waiter found enough time to complain to customers (us) about having to work over such a large area. Sorry but that's what his job was I thought. Service slow and the waiter appeared to me to have no idea who ordered what. Then he would get mad at the customers arguing with them as to what they ordered. 

Was not a happy meeting. 

Would not go back.
author: R S.

description:
Service was ok 
Food was ok
Would I come back? I would maybe try a different place first. Not sure if it was worth it for the price 
Looked like they had a lot of regulars 
I had the halibut
My friend had the red snapper
Both were average
The salad was just ice berg  lettuce with carrots, red cabbage and radishes. I expected a little more fancy and dressed up salad for the place
The pasta was I again, for the price-it was just ok.
author: Merry L.

description:
This was our neighbourhood go-to for food when we wanted a nice place, good food and neighbourly service.

We booked my boyfriends birthday dinner wth family. We arrived on time at 6:30p on a Sunday.

It was much busier than normal
We were told the table wasnt ready. No
Problem. We had a drink at the bar. 

45 minutes later we were seated.

6 people, spending money on drinks and dinner. Willing to drink and dine and have fun

Waitress was rude, unfocused, angry and with an attitude that was unwarranted and surprising 

I asked to speak to the manager. 
Alas it was this waitress!

She did not speak to us but plied us with more and more attitude throughout the dinner. 

I am appalled at the service and disappointed that we ever gave them our time and money 

Shame on you for treating us with such disdain!

Horrible service for a Place that we always loved.
author: Cora Y.

description: Wonderful little gem we stumbled on - classy - with Wonderful service. Felt like we had walked back in time - intimate - cozy - attentive service with great food. The female bartender (from Ireland) was so sweet - I had sprained a muscle in my leg and she gave me a nice bag of ice to take back to my hotel room. Will definitely visit again the next time I'm in the City.
author: Deborah G.

description:
I'm getting old.  I could have sworn I wrote a review of Ristorante Marcello long ago.  Well, let's remedy that right now.

I love this place.  It is decidedly not hip, but neither am I.  Actually, that's one of the things I find refreshing about it.  It's a neighborhood restaurant and bar with the same folks sitting at the bar who were there in 1968.  Not a man bun in sight.  It's a breath of fresh air.

It's an old-time red-sauce Italian place, and the food is delicious and plentiful.  The best thing on the menu, though, is the minestrone.  Dear Lord, is it good.  It's thick and fragrant and warms my soul, especially with a thick slice of sourdough bread and butter and a glass of Italian red.  That is the old San Francisco. -But I digress.

The pasta is great.  The petrale sole is wonderful.  The chicken piccata is delicious.  Ristorante Marcello is old school.  Their menu is traditional.  They do traditional dishes, and they do them well.  Their prices are reasonable.  The waiters wear tuxes.  

Give 'em a try, but please save me some minestrone.
author: Earline A.

description:
I was in a good mood and hasn't seen my sister's family in a while so I invited everybody to dinner. I originally suggested pizza, but my sister suggested we try Marcello's since it was near her house.  I hadn't even considered it since the restaurant doesn't have a single window, but I was feeling adventurous so we walked the short block and a half over together. The decor is absolutely classic Italian as you might remember from the 70s, and really nothing has changed since.  Casino, Goodfellas, and other Sopranos, come to mind.

We decided to start with their hearts of palm salad, which was tasty and well-seasoned, but definitely came out of a can.  I decided to go with my gut and try the fettuccine Alfredo, and was thrilled to smell the presence of nutmeg in the dish. Flavors were classic Alfredo and the pasta had a wonderful al dente bite.  I wish there was a blackened chicken option but that might be more modern take.  The other dishes were pretty tasty as well, and I was a fan of my nephew's gnocchi and pesto.

Service was really friendly and made you feel like part of the family.  Prices are moderate and certainly not over the top.  There are absolutely no windows, which makes approaching the restaurant kind of sketch, but I assure you it's worth a try.  I'd definitely come back!

Food: 7/10

Service: 8/10

Price: $$

Atmosphere: 7/10
author: Joe M.

description:
Before the ballet on a Thursday night we had a early dinner here with reservations for 5:30. Service was excellent as well as the noise level. As Marcello's started to fill a bit, the noise level only increased a little. 

Five of us ordered various pasta dishes and were very pleased with all. Everything was fresh, tasty and arrived after an average wait for made to order dishes. 

Parking may be difficult as this is a mixed residential/commercial area. 

The restaurant seemed clean and a little old school with many of the patrons the same. Not a loud type of crowd.

Prices are a bit more than the Yelp menu link.
author: Pierce S.

description:
This restaurant is a hidden gem! My friend took me here and I fell in love with their Spaghetti Alla Matriana. I live in Oakland but I have been eating here for over 15 years now and try to eat here as much as I can. It's a little out of the way for me and parking can be tough, but it's worth it! 

The restaurant has that old 60s feel to it and they have a LOT of regular customers. Great service, good portions, tasty pastas, and good dessert.

I recommend the carpaccio, spaghetti Alla matriciana, escargot, chicken parmesan, bolognese, and salads.
author: Jennifer J.

description:
I hate to give this place only 3 stars, because it's cute, quaint and fairly classy local business. But I was pretty underwhelmed by my two visits here and I don't think I'm going to give it a third try.

The food is not bad, but it's nothing to write home about for how much you're paying. The carbonara was a bit bland and almost on the dry side. The spaghetti matriciana was ok, but actually tasted the better as leftovers the next day. I think sitting in my fridge allowed the flavors to meld and intensify a little more. Portions are big though. The prosciutto and melon was great, but you can't really mess that up. 

The service is friendly as well, but maybe a little too friendly. My biggest gripe was that I ate there alone one night and the bus boy made constant comments about my race and how much he loved Chinese women. It made me uncomfortable even though he was incredibly nice. It was completely inappropriate.

I think it's a nice place to come for a quiet dinner, but maybe for a different kind of crowd.
author: Rebekah H.

description:
What a delightful experience. I grew up in the Sunset District, & the restaurant I usually go to, had no parking. So I drove around & found this wonderful restaurant. I had no reservation but the Owner?, I think he was the owner said he would find a table for me & my boyfriend. He was simply charming. 

Everything was perfect, from the atmosphere to the food, & the delightful waitress, & waiter. 

We especially loved our steak dinners, & that lovely French bread. I will be back, & this time take my brother with us. And of course this time I will make reservations!
author: Carol G.

description:
On my first experience coming here, I had lost my phone at the beach earlier in the day...after some frantic running around and use of Find My Phone, we were called by some people who had found the phone. After that all I wanted was a nice comfy place to eat dinner and Restorante Marcello fit the bill. The atmosphere and uniforms worn by the staff are very much from a different era (early 1960's), but this only adds to the charm. I notice a lot of families and older adults gathering together here to sit down and enjoy a meal together. I appreciate how the staff are extremely friendly. We've come here a few times now and ordered the below dishes and enjoyed them quite a bit.

home made tortellini with cream sauce - delicious. peas, panchetta and a little bit of spice
bolognese sauce - standard, but still tasty and comforting
Ravioli - yum
Veal Parmesean - delicious. The veal was excellent.
Fettucini Vongole - tasty, but would be nice if they used fresh clams
author: Alice H.

description:
Very classic italian restaurant but high quality good.
We have enjoyed raviolis and veal Wotherspoon lemon sauce and it was excellent; desserts were also nice.
A good quality price ratio with a good service to be recommended
author: Jacques B.

description: Excellent food & services. Fair prices.
author: Carl G.

description: Best pasta around. Marcello is usually seating you and the atmosphere is quaint. Waiters are funny and entertaining. You really want to go for the pasta. Other dishes are amazing also, but pasta is memorable.
author: Lucky J.

description:
You know you're in for a good night when you walk in and a dapper tux wearing man greets you with a smile!

Minestrone is awesome.  Just awesome.

Chicken Parm/Veal Saltimboca/Swordfish/Petrale Sole

I never know what to have because I love them all equally!

Dinner for 4, a bottle of wine, and a dessert to share was right around $100.  Cant beat that!

Do yourself a favor and stop in.
author: Katy M.

description:
One of the best Italian restaurants I've been to on this side of the city! 

The service was great to start with. I love when the waiters actually talk to you rather than just taking your order. Both of them were extremely nice people. The inside has a pretty big full bar and the dining area is decently sized. It has an older type of feel to it, which I didn't mind. It's perfect for a romantic date or a night out with the family. 

As far as the food, it was so delicious! The bread that they serve was little harder than I'd like but it was still pretty good. I ordered the special of the night which was meat ravioli with pink sauce paired with a nice glass of Cabernet. There was just the right amount of food. It didn't leave me hungry or overly stuffed. My friend ordered their eggplant parmigiana. She said it was the best she'd ever had. 

I couldn't leave without having dessert. I got my usual, cheesecake. I wouldn't say it was the best dense cheesecake I've ever had, but it was really good and I was satisfied. On the other hand, my friend ordered their gelato(half chocolate/half hazelnut). I was disappointed with it due to all the good reviews for it on yelp. The hazelnut part was delicious, however the chocolate had some frostbite on it as it did taste a little old.

Ristorante Marcello is in the 2 dollar sign range but on the higher end of it. 

Regardless, I really enjoyed this place and definitely will come back!
author: Priyam D.

description:
LOVE LOVE LOVE Marcello's.

When I went for my first time... I have to say I was a little intimidated by exterior decor. Lightweight felt like I was about to walk into a restaurant owned by the mob in the 70s...

...until we walked in. The inside is amazing! Totally felt like an old-fashioned family-style restaurant that I would find in a back alley in Italy (although I guess to some it could seem a little dingy). The owners and waitstaff are all super friendly as well--one of the waiters even helped me take off my coat when he saw I was struggling to get out of one of my sleeves!

What to expect: -if you get there towards the early side of the evening.... be prepared for a crowd of 80+ couples who are dressed to impress and are out for date night. So adorable, but mildly awkward if you go with anyone under the age of 40 and decide to wear jeans.

-cool decor and fun people watching

-amazing service (the waiters/busboys are so nice, and in tuxes!) and great food/dessert/wine selections

"Yay I'm a fan" is right! But Marcello's, please add bruschetta to your list of antipasti!
author: Sam D.

description: I had the minestrone and spaghetti. They were both good. The food here is casual, home style. The decor is seriously dated and you can barely tell the place is open by the front door, but I enjoyed my meal and the service at the bar was good.
author: Will D.

description:
Really cute old fashioned Italian place tucked away in the sunset area! 

My friends say they always drive by this place and always wanted to try it. Looks unassuming from the outside but inside it looks very vintage and old school. 

The waiters are dressed better than you as they are all in black and white tuxs! My friends and I felt really underdressed lol! 

But everyone was very helpful and friendly! Our waiter was very personable and made us laugh a couple of times.

We started with one of the specials which were lightly battered and fried porcini mushrooms that were local. The mushrooms were delish and it was lighter than expected especially just adding a little bit of lemon juices on it! We also shared the beef carpaccio. This was good but I did feel like the sauce that was on the beef was a bit too overpowering

My friend and I both got the special which was meat ravioli or porcini ravioli with a pink sauce. Both raviolis were really good and we couldn't decide which was better!

It's a cute place and I would come back again!
author: Christine W.

description:
We had not been to Marcelo's since moving out of the city - 1999.
The food is still as superb as it was back then!  The veal Marcelo was tastier than ever!  Service was great.  Best Italian food around and very reasonably priced.  
The only reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is the decor could be "refreshed" a bit.
author: Rebecca B.

description: Definitely one of the best Italian restaurants I have been to. I would recommend the dinner deluxe special it is worth the price considering everything that comes with it. Good service as well!
author: Jamie M.

description:
Very nice people but the food didn't taste fresh nor remotely homemade.

It was very bland and not what I was expecting for the price.

They were very understaffed the evening we ate there also.
author: Charles S.

description: This restaurant has special meaning to me as my grandfather used to take our family there often, the food was always amazing. I have been feeling nostalgic & would like to go back soon, happy to see it is still owned by Marcello, who was a friend of my grandfathers until he passed away in 2003. Marcello also happens to have lived in the same town I live in the East Bay, the old Baldochi house still stands today, a historical beauty in downtown Antioch.
author: Lisa P.

description:
A nostalgic, but - so, so sad to say - very disappointing dinner...  
It had been a long time, and a lot has changed in a decade.  The quality of the food and service has greatly diminished.  
Our waitress was curt, inattentive to the point of rudeness, and never broke a smile.  The food was disappointing, with the majority of what we ordered just plain bad.  The gnocchi was like paste.  The pesto was bitter, and so was the sauce the scallops were swinging in.  The scallops themselves were past their prime.  Even my carbaholic children didn't eat their (terribly bland) spaghetti and ravioli.  The only bright spots were the minestrone and the Caesar salad.  The veal parmigiana was edible but nothing compared with what it used to be.  The desserts were very forgettable.  My old favorite "Strawberries Julius II" tasted of mold.  We walked away very disappointed, and - having been a habitué a decade and a half ago - embarrassed for this once great restaurant.
author: Alex I.

description:
Well, it's a restaurant for old timers in the Sunset. Prices are reasonable and the food was decent. Most entrees were around $25 and included soup/salad and coffee. Hard to make an argument against that ;)

Most people dining here grew up on typewriters and there's nothing wrong with that. I would also say that a majority of those dining were native San Franciscans...You can just tell. If you don't go in expecting a high end dining experience, and see it for what it is, you'll be happy. It's a neighborhood place that's been here since the 60's and it's good at being what it is - A place for the local old timers.
author: Con L.

description: I love this place, mostly for the atmosphere, but also because of their classic Italian American menu. If they have anything with mushrooms, I go for that, the owner is apparently obsessed with them. But be warned: side salads and other sides are not very fresh or good...well, at least for organic, locally sourced, blah blah Californian standards.
author: Amity B.

description:
I haven't been to this restaurant since my childhood, when we went every week, but I'll go ahead and assume that nothing has changed! Very old school, lots of fur coats, waiters in tuxes, and the cigarette smoke of old still lingering in the air.

This place serves a version of spaghetti alla matriciana that I have been struggling my whole adult life to recreate. Excellent food. So many memories.
author: Alexandra L.

description:
This mom and pop shop was very good about accommodating a party of about 20 people for a birthday party.  It didn't leave very much room for people to move around though.  

Menu is not in English, so it was a little confusing to order.  I couldn't speak for anyone else, but I ordered the halibut and it was delicious, but not quite enough to make you full.  It came with a small side of veggies - maybe 3-4 pieces, but it needed a carb or something.  

I don't think I'll be back unless someone I'm hanging out with realllllllly wanted to come here.
author: Jenny L.

description: I made last minute reservations for this place and i guess we got lucky.  The serve here is pretty good.  The food wasn't bad, it was better than eating at chain restuarants. I got the linguine with clams and i engjoyed it a lot. There was a lot of clams on it, which was to my surprise. My friend got the sweetbread and was disappointed in it because it tasted like chicken. I've never had sweetbread so i can't judge.
author: Belinda C.

description:
I do think that the atmosphere of Ristorante Marcello exudes old-school charm and that is quite nice. Unfortunately, my food was more in the meh category. The highlight of the meal was the avocado salad. However, I wasn't smart enough to order that so I only got to eat a little from someone else's plate. They do make delicious Italian dressing here as well, but my main course of Spaghetti alla Carbonara definitely was not worth the price I paid for it. It was a huge portion to be sure, but the flavoring was rather bland to me and the noodles were a bit clumpy.

Sir Nicholas and I also were the youngest diners there by a long shot - I'd say the average age was around 65 on the night we went (a Thursday.) I personally don't have any problem with that, but it does set the mood a little.
author: Tiffany N.

description: Cozy family style Italiam restaurant always filled with old folks. Great menu filled with your standard Italiam food. Chicken parm and raviolis are pretty good but I couldn't tell you anything too spectacular about this place.
author: Anastasia P.

description:
THE hidden gem in SF. This homey Italian restaurant is located ever-so-casually at Parkside. The place is spacious, with a very friendly gentleman as your server to pamper you with delicious food. Not to mention their generous servings. All this for a reasonable price.

I was craving Vongole in particular, and the only place I could find on Yelp in proximity was Marcello. Drove about 20 minutes from where I was, and arrived slightly earlier than their opening time - but they still let us in! Very comfortable atmosphere, and along with the great service, this place really makes you feel happy that you are there.

Their house special salad is refreshing and light, and their soup of the day was very warming. Nothing was overly-seasoned/oily/dry, everything was just right. According to the gentleman who was our server, they make their pasta slightly thinner than elsewhere, because it gives a better flavor. I found this out when I asked him about the angelhair-thin Vongole that came out. It did taste good, and the portions were ginormous. LOTS of clams, already taken out of their shells - I really appreciated this since this shows that Marcello wasn't skimping out on the clams (many places tend to place just under a dozen clams, in their shells, in order to make it look like there is a lot). 

By the time I finished my beloved Vongole, I was too full for dessert. But there's always next time, because I plan on making this my go-to Ristorante in the Bay Area. 


**Tip: Also seems great for families. By the time we left, there were groups of large families, and everyone seemed so happy. I feel like this is the place I would want to share with people I love.
author: Soo Jung R.

description:
I've been coming to this neighboorhood restaurant for 20+ years as I use to live in the Sunset.

Its an old world mafia feel NYC style of Italian Restaurant (without the mobsters, though it definitely has that feel).  One of Herb Caen's favorites (rightfully so)... as he has written articles about this great old establishment.  The service is great and staffed with all the people I've gotten to know over 20 years.

The food over the years has gone down a bit, as they like most restaurant fight to keep their prices competitive and reasonable, unfortunately this has impacted their quality.

I am still a fan because they have good Veal, Sweatbread offerings at reasonable prices.  The waitors has been around for years and still serve up good service with penguin suits.

I admire their Salmone cooked with Champaigne sauce, something I've mastered over the years using Ristorante Marcello as a reference point.
This is why I still have a soft part in my heart for this great neighboorhood establishment that still packs them in.
author: David H.

description:
The ambiance according to the restaurant is classy. That is the last thing this place is from the food to the service. 

If you're looking for an Italian restaurant, and not dressed up, don't go here. they will sit you in the back with all the other non-dressed up people. That should have been my first sign to get out of there when I clearly saw more then enough tables open where the semi dressed up people were sitting.  

The lady that was serving us was unprofessional and made the restaurant seem lower then a 1 star in my book. She ate chips in eye sight and checked her phone multiple times. this was all while our water glasses had been empty for about 10 minutes. 

The poor service didn't even make up for the less then mediocre food. I will never go back.
author: Ellie C.

description:
Perhaps I'm a little jaded, but when I sit down and a dirty, yellow-crusted fork greets me, I'm not a happy camper. My aunt had dirty silverware as well. Get a new dishwasher. When the lady asked if I wanted cheese on the pasta, she didn't wait for my response and put cheese on anyway, that was a little upsetting. Actually, her service in general was upsetting. This middle-aged red head looked like she didn't want to be there, and she was so sassy and rude when we asked for the most basic service. I've never really encountered such a rude, curt person in the service industry. The busboy/gentlemen in the yellow coat was a much better server; he was kind and was very respectable. 
It's the little things that make an experience a great one. 
The food was a solid 2 on a 5-star scale.
I really don't know what everyone else is raving about in regard to this establishment. I'm never coming to this place ever again.
author: Lisa Y.

description: Yes, the interior is tacky in a "This was probably considered classy looking in the 80s, but now it's simply aged;" but the food and service when I've had dinner here were excellent and I was never dressed up so I don't understand other Yelpers' complaints regarding poor service in response to casual attire. I love the avocado and shrimp salad and the minestrone soup.
author: Becca L.

description:
If you want some real good wine and a delicious pasta dish, I'd recommend this place. It also has a full bar too.

Two of my friends ordered the Fettuccine Alfredo and one ordered the Pesto with Penne. I learned not to order something I recognize at an Italian restaurant. Its either too bland or too salty. 

I er..ordered something I recognized but it was just the pasta part. I had the Linguine with Volgno (garlic baby clams) and a glass of Pinot Grigio. I must say my meal was really good with a glass of wine. My meal came out piping hot and the waiter was friendly and knowledgeable about my wine questions. 

Ristorante Marcello is a bit pricey, but its affordable. I really recommend this place for special occasions like a birthday for a family member, prom, or a romantic date. 

Trust me, you'll like what you see on the menu.
author: Jason C. J.

description: Love Marcello's it's Small but great food. Music is a little loud but adds to the atmosphere. Parking is a gamble but, that's everywhere. I had the Salmon and it was out of this world!! Love it! Our waiter was great! We came in from Sacramento just for Dinner! It was worth the 3 hour drive in Mothers Day Traffic!
author: Paul Y.

description:
If you are looking for a great Italian Place to eat and dont want to go all the way to North Beach Marcellos is tha spot.

Great Appetizers! Highly Recommended the Prawns Marcello, Avaocado.

Entrees! Linguine and Clams with White Sauce and the Rack Of Lamb.  Oh and a great Roasted Chicken....
author: King L.

description:
I've driven by this place a million times, and never thought of actually checking it out until someone who grew up in the area raved about it.

The outside of the building doesn't look very welcoming.  It's all enclosed with no windows to peak in.  It doesn't look like something that I would want to check out without a recommendation from a trusted source.

My husband and I decided to give it a try after a friend raved about it.  To our surprised, the inside looks very different.  It's semi-modern, spacious with nice deco.  All the waiters wear a tux.   It's looks like a very traditional Italian family own biz.  It gears toward families.  It does have a bar...

I order the house salad and shrimp scampi and both very good.  I always love shrimp scampi.  However, my coffee/tea never came as part of the set dinner.  By the time I realized that it didn't come, it was too late already (i.e., time to get the check) so I didn't bother to say anything.  

The service in general is good, though the lady who served our table is polite, but didn't smile much.
author: Lolipop W.

description:
Best escargot I've had in the city so far....ended up ordering 2!

Once you walk in, it's like you walked back into the 1980s.  Old school italian restaurant - waiter and maitre'd in old tuxedos, decor leaves much to be desired.  Pastas are pretty good, but the best for me really was the escargot.
author: Theresa N.

description: Food never disappoints. My absolute favorite restaurant + best veal in SF (you can cut it with your fork)...feels like home and is cozy as hell. If rack of lamb or the salmon with champagne sauce is on the specials menu, get that ish quick...so good and the lamb always sell out quick. Always order entrees as the dinner option. You get pasta and their amazing house salad. Warm bread too...wear your eating pants.
author: Will K.

description: I usually feel like I'm pretty "in synch" with other Yelpers...but this is an exception. I went to Marcello's for the first time tonight and thought it was awful from start to finish. The exterior is nondescript and uninviting, the interior is tacky (fake flowers with glitter, dusty ribbons, you get the picture). We were a party of seven...shoved into a too-tight, poorly set table, our waiter was indifferent at best, seemed generally annoyed that we had questions about the menu...the food was too salty, over sauced, mediocre. Highlights were the bartender who was friendly and efficient, the clam chowder which was good, and the calamari steaks...but all in all, the bad outweighed the good...I won't go back. So disappointing!
author: Linda L.

description:
The outside's very unassuming (from the lack of windows). You will definitely have trouble finding parking, but that's the price you have to pay when you drive in San Francisco...

When you walk in you can tell that they have done little redecorating--The white tablecloths, the servers in tuxes, the decor; it feels very home-y and cozy.

The atmosphere here is very... fancy. Fancy as in you should probably wear something nice when you eat here, something reminiscent of your Sunday best--walking in with super casual clothing might give you some weird stares from people. For me, it's slightly intimidating because I usually don't eat at these kind of upscale restaurants.

I had the veal milanese. It was probably one of the only times I've had veal and it was really good. For dessert I had hazelnut ice cream--or was it gelato?--which was absolutely delicious. So delicious, I would want to bathe in it. Like seriously, get it for dessert and revel in the hazelnutty bliss.

Me and my significant other were being taken out to dinner by his parents, and I felt bad that they paid for our meals--it's a little on the expensive side.

As for service we were treated pretty well, mainly because my SO's parents have been going there for years and may or may not know some of the people who run the place. The servers were very polite to us.

It's a nice place to go to for a formal dinner, especially if you feel like dressing up. Me? I'm probably not going to eat here again anytime soon.
author: Trista B.

description:
You'd never know just walking by, but this place is a hidden gem behind it's unassuming facade.  The waiters are in tuxes, and they do fancy things with the wine and champagne that I'm not used to (i.e. showing you the label and letting you try it first).  I find it refreshing that places still do things the old school way.  

I adore the food here.  I think the prices are so reasonable for the amount of food you get!  They give you pasta and salad and a meal - and bread!  I always get the chicken picatta - yummy buttery chard and potatoes on the side.  

All fanciness aside, I always feel extra classy when I'm eating here.  It's charming and homey on the inside, with a classic feel - it's been around for over 30 years, so they obviously have got something good here at Ristorante Marcello.
author: Ashley S.

description: Very nice meal. Minestrone and risotto were terrific. Price was affordable and service was attentive.
author: Mike A.

description:
As usual, you'll always have trouble finding parking. 

Even though we had a reservation for 7PM, we weren't seated until after because the restaurant was packed full of diners. There was a bar separate from the dining area for those who want to watch sports or get a drink while waiting for their seats. Over all the decor has a very homey feel. I was surprised that it was pretty noisy after we got seated. The ambiance and look felt more intimite and quite, but I guess it was too full for that. Half the patrons were dressed nicely and the other half were casual. At least I didn't feel overdressed.

The service was very attentive here and the server liked to joke with us. I was sitting alone at the table at one point and the server came by to refill my water. He joked, "Left you with the bill huh?"

We had the Prawns Marcello for the appetizer and it tasted delicious. Too bad the portion was so small. It left us watering for more. For entrees we had the Veal Marcello and the seabass special. When the veal came we were suprised because it just looked like it was slapped onto the plate and looked like a soggy, saucy mess. The seabass was quite a big portion. I should have asked if it was Alaskan seabass or not since that is the type I like to eat. It wasn't Alaskan, but the fish was tender. However, it was very salty and I was so sad to discover that it was dry. Overcooked fish always makes me sad. I like the potato and green sides but the fish did make me too full to finish the potatoes.
author: Jay L.

description: We were greeted and seated promptly by a friendly staff person.  Our waiter was efficient and courteous.  The atmosphere was warm and cozy and all the staff made us feel at home.  The food was fabulous.  Was easy to find and get to via public transportation.  Highly recommend.
author: Sharon L.

description: Very pleasantly surprised by this Sunset gem. The ambiance made me homesick for the east coast and the food did not disappoint. I asked the waitress to choose an entree for me. She brought a veal dish named for someone (the dishwasher?) who works in the kitchen. It was truly amazing. I'll be back!
author: Sid D.

description:
My friend and partner had a simple pasta bolognese. I had pasta carbonara. My dish was by far superior to the bolognese--but the bolognese was not stellar. 

What really honest offset our experience was the service. The place was relatively busy--but we were profiled based on our menu choices and somewhat "abandoned" comparatively speaking. At the end of our meal we were given styrofoam boxes--which is shocking considering San Francisco and California law. Our friend noticed that other guests had been given smaller plastic boxes--so we asked for those instead. Interestingly as well, the waiter (earlier when he brought our table styrofoam) dropped them off and walked away for a good while. When he brought us plastic--he immediately put our leftovers in our boxes for us. Strange first experience, decent food.

Not overpriced, but around $20 for a meat dish. Will look forward to giving them one more try.
author: Carlos H.

description: I literally felt like I should be invited to Christmas dinner after eating here. It is a really sweet, family owned restaurant where everyone welcomes you. It has the charm that most restaurants don't have anymore. The bar is welcoming and after sitting there for a few minutes we met and started chatting with a few wonderful people. It is really a cohesive and welcoming environment. When we were seated and couldn't decide what to order, the waiter asked us what we were in the mood for and the waiter nailed it on meal suggestions. I highly recommend this gem!
author: Johanna W.

description:
Let's do the time warp again----
Old school Italian served by waiters in tuxes. Some dishes can be hits, while others are misses. Stick with the classics.
author: Cynthia J.

description:
We went there on a week night around 8ish.  We had to wait to be seated even though it was not busy.  The service was not the best as I had to inquire as to how certain dishes are prepared.

The food was nothing spectacular.  The prosciutto with melon appetizer was good enough.  My companion's ravioli was so-so.  My chicken rustic-style was basically lots of onions in some kind of sauce with chicken.  The chicken was falling off the bone yet not tasty - I don't know how they achieved that in such a short amount of time it took to prepare.  They must've cooked it ahead of time and then threw it in the saute mix with lots of onions.  The onions overwhelmed the rest of the dish.

All in all, I don't know why this place has an average rating of 4-stars given the lackluster taste of the food.  The prices are too high for the quality of the food.   I would not recommend it.
author: William L.

description:
For a sec there, I arrived at Marcello's with a little less expectation, the building of the restaurant was made out of solid rock materials which prevented me seeing the inside from the outside, which was quite a bummer because once youve reached the inside, its actually not that bad, in fact, it had a home vibe in it. Came here to celebrate with my friends for the end of semester from college and i enjoyed the place. Its not so crowded that its loud but it had people also inside which means its not a complete silent. 

Service wise, i think it was pretty decent, I just wished that the manager would get waitress who understands english better because everytime i asked for a little parmesan on my pasta, the waitress also adds tons tons of cheese. But overall, they welcomed me nicely. 

Food wise, I had the three course meal with the salad, soup of the day(minestroni)  and special Chicken pasta Marcello's, the pasta def my favorite food in the restaurant, the texture of the creamy chicken with mushrooms and the pasta was just right. I really enjoyed eating in here, had a good time too with my friends. 

Food: 3.5
Service:3
Ambiance:3.5
Overall:3

I'd come here again if I was in the neighborhood.
author: Cavin T.

description:
I so wanted to love this place, like really really love this place, it bothered me that yelped has took me to the wrong place... the only thing that was amazing about this place was that the service was amazing... that's what got me the most.. How much I love good costumer  service, but the food was horrible..........

BOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO
the seafood linguini was freaking horrible. flavors was indescribably bad, and the chicken parmsesen maybe the worst I've ever had. I can honestly say that in comparison to the hungry man's frozen dinner and marcello's Parmesan chicken .... hungry man's is by far much better...
oh crap I forgot my Caesar salad.. that was decent, and I really wanted to like it, because the ambiance was so freaking amazing.. I felt like I was in a Scarface movie..... all in all.. maybe I will update this soon with a better review.... but as for now it sucked., and my hype was so overrated. 

I totally wanted to love it but i couldn't..sorry maybe next time.... I'm going to give it one more chance... one day.... or maybe not
author: Nina M.

description:
Dear Marcello:

You have turned me in a very, very selfish girl. I have been to your place twice this month and I have purposely did not Yelp about you.
What have you done to me? I was not like this before I met you. 

I must let you go now - I must let others enjoy you. As an Elite Yelper, I have a civic, Yelp duty to share great reviews. As so, I have to Yelp you, and reveal you to the world. 

Oh Marcello. I will be back. Things will not be the same between us anymore. More people will come to you, love you, Yelp you and they too, will spread how good you are to everyone.  You deserve this. I cannot bear to be so selfish anymore.

xoxo, Vanessa
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
North Beach serves the absolute best Italian food? Hm. No.

Ristorante Marcello is a fantastic, Italian restaurant tucked away in "the Set" [Sunset District]. This place has no windows. It's as if this is an Italian food lovers secret society -- and this is the meeting place.

When you first walk in [hopefully you've made reservations], you open a big wooden door. You walk in and there is a bar with local patrons all around - talking, laughing and drinking. On your left you see an upper level of many tables full of deliciousness, glasses filled with wine, happy, dressed up women with ruby red lipstick and big, grandpa-like men enjoying themselves. This is the place to be.

The dining area is intimate, and the waiters and busboys maneuver their way around to provide the best, top-notch service.  This restaurant has white walls, adorned with paintings. There is a fireplace near the entrance to a kitchen and you feel like you might be in grandma's cozy living room. It is warm and inviting -- very Italian. The servers are Italian and give great service - always checking up on you [but not disturbing you] & they give great recommendations on wine and what to order. 

The food. Every night, Marcello's has specials. Valentine's Day night specials included: veal, rabbit and salmon. 

They bring fresh baked bread and butter after you order. 

Appetizers - their clam chowder is creamy and comforting. 
Their artichoke hearts was delicious and came with a great olive oil/vinaigrette dipping sauce. 

For their entrees - their roasted half chicken is cooked to perfection and tender. 
Their rigatoni with bologonese sauce is delicious. I try making my own and never again! - Italians always do it better.
Their Canolini is cheesy and filled with meat and some more cheese -- all the leftover cheese is perfect as a dipping sauce for the bread.

Marcello's wine list is quite extensive; I personally like Rieslings when I eat Italian foods.

For dessert, they often have different flavored ice creams among other Italian desserts.

You will leave here feeling full, a little buzzed, very warm, and very, very happy.
author: Vanessa W.

description:
discovering new restaurants to try one day at a time...

we in ocean beach, daughter wanted spaghetti and meatballs.  yelp italian and here we go.

no meatballs though...ordered:

shrimp cocktail - straight forward, small in size but okay. bay shrimps

escargot - nice ratio of garlic, butter, olive oil, hacher parsley, dipped breads in it!

spaghetti marchiatte (pancetta and tomato sauce) - very good light soft pasta and perfect flavors

gnocchi bolognese - one of the more doughy heavy gnocchi i've had, sauce on sweet side

prawns livornese (tomato, capers, onions and olives) - little too salty for my taste, i understand the capers and olive can add to the salt flavor

chicken dore (egg battered, sauteed with lemon butter) - little too lemony but i like. chicken very tender and juicy.  good to mop up the sauce with the veggies and mash potatoes that came with it.

overall,  good old fashion italian out in the SUN...SET!!!
author: Kevin L.

description:
Took my friends here for their 21st birthday. The experience was good. Unfortunately, the names on the menu was not necessarily in English, so i forgot the names of what everyone ordered. 

The dishes itself was very delicious, the waiter that we had was very nice. however, he didn't seem quite happy about serving a bunch of kids that look way younger than what we really are. 

I expected the atmosphere of this type of restaurant to be a little less noisy. The prices were very reasonable. A good place to have a date with someone special. and don't let the gigantic mushroom near the bar turn you away from this place. haha
author: Andrew H.

description:
Service: 5/5
Food: 3/5 
Cleanliness: 3/5
Area: 4/5
Price: 3.5/5 - it's not cheap

I feel bad giving this place a 3 star, I really do. Me and my family came here because my step-dads co-worker gave him a gift certificate to this restaurant. Supposedly he said it brings back childhood memories, since his grandmother used to take him there all the time...making it a pretty old restaurant. 

Service was nice. I believe it is a family owned business. Our waitress was very helpful in helping us choose our dishes.

Food was not was I expected it to be. I was expecting more homecooked dishes with some secret sauce or ingredient but seems to be that the secret ingredient was adding extra oil to every dish. I ordered the carbonara with bacon. I was expecting to eat a creamy pasta meal with a pouched egg over it or something, but turned out to be a big plate of pasta, olive oil, and small bacon bits..I wasn't feeling it, and neither was my mother and her zucchini dish.

The restaurant needs redecorating/renovation. You can tell it's been in business for years and that the customers are loyal customers. I saw a lot of elders... but I gotta say, it's a new generation! Young people love eating and if a business is to succeed, it has to step it up with some flavaaa or that extra pinch. This place is missing something..
author: Lisa M.

description:
After seeing this restaurant had four stars on average, the highlighted review said family friendly, and was rated at only 2 $'s, I figured this place would be good to take my two friends to while I was in town.

I should have walked out the moment I walked in. The first sign that something was amiss was when I realized that we may have been underdressed as we entered the place but we were still paying customers, and the reviews on yelp HAD said family friendly, so i dismissed the thought. 

The hostess came up after giving me and my friends the "once over", and She LITERALLY pursed her lips as I smiled and asked for a table for 3. She then clucked her tongue when i mentioned we didn't have a reservation. Her reservation book was empty, she perused it right in front of me like she was looking to see if she had any space available, so why would a restaurant be upset about a walk in when there were no reservations? I would have rather just been turned away because we weren't up to dress code. We then waited about ten minutes for a table at a half empty restaurant. 

I knew yelp is sometimes incorrect about pricing, but I never realized how off  it could be. I would not consider $25 (on average) per plate a 2 dollar sign restaurant. We had barely sat down when our waiter came up and asked us what we wanted to drink. We were still contemplating when he rattled off all the specials of the day and walked off without our drink orders. 

About 12-15 minutes later, after being ignored by the waiter, we had to hail him down by mentioning we were ready to order our dinner. Even after our vocal notice, he continued To ignore us (didn't even acknowledge we were there) and the bus boy brought us cold water (iceless) to sip while we waited. When the waiter finally did get back to our table, my two friends ordered fettuccine Alfredo (both opted just to drink water, though the waiter didn't even ask them if they wanted anything else) while I ordered the tortteline ala panna along with an iced tea. 

After the waiter left the bus boy came and refilled our waters. Our food DID come out in record times, but my iced tea was missing. I didn't mention anything was amiss because I wished to see how long it would take them to realize their error. The whole time we sat at the table, the waiter walked past us over twelve times to serve the customers around us. 4 other parties that came in after us were catered to first, 2 of those parties received their meals first. never, during his waiting other tables, were we asked how our food was or if we needed anything. The fettuccine, so I'm told, was mediocre at best, and my tortteline was in one of the saddest excuses for a sauce I'd ever seen or tasted. 

The only saving grace of the whole meal, was the bread that they served 3 moments before our meal came out. After we were finished eating, the bus boy finally came out with my iced tea. I told the man we were already done eating and I didn't want it anymore. Why was the bus boy serving us anyway? The waiter served drinks at the other tables, why hadn't he served us? 

the entire time we were seated, not once had the waiter come up and asked us how our meal was, or if we needed anything else. He didn't even check our water glasses, which were empty halfway through the meal, mine even before he had taken our orders. he did ask us if we wanted dessert when he handed me the check.

after i payed for the check, wanting to get out of there as quickly as possible, I didn't even realize they had charged me for the iced tea I hadn't even received, let alone drank, until the END of dinner, until after I got home. 

Before we left the building, one of my friends went to the restroom, once we had  left, she mentioned that the servers she walked by on the way back to our table had all given her dirty looks. I will NEVER recommend this place to anybody. I've been more attended to at a coffee shop than I have here.
author: Tabitha O.

description:
I had heard that this place was old school and had been drawing a crowd of regulars since the 70's, but I was still surprised to find our table to be the only one without a person over 70.  That combined with the fact that it has obviously never been remodeled, give it a serious time-warp feel, which is actually pretty cool if you're into that sort of thing.

Anyway, I'm not exactly an italian food connoisseur, so I just tried something that sounded old school: the spaghetti alla matricianna.  Best spaghetti ever.  Other people's dishes, like the pesto pasta, weren't as phenomenal.  The other major dish of note is the spumoni: it's the real thing.

If you're up for the ambience, you could certainly have a good dinner here.
author: Wes M.

description:
O how I love to find new and wonderful gems.  When you are outside of Ristorante Marcello, you brace yourself b/c it looks like a seedy bar.  You expect that when you open the door, you will be surrounded by smoke (well two women were smoking outside already).  You are pleasantly surprised to find a paradoxical atmosphere of fine dining and relaxation.  The waiter is extremely funny and kind.  Regulars come there as frequently as a daily basis.  The clientele were senior citizens minus myself, mom, and a couple.  The gentleman next to us stated, "I don't use Facebook or Twitty! LOL When I talk on the phone, I don't need all that stuff, just hello-goodbye."  Ahh, where else will you find awesome people like that?

I ordered the ravioli with pink sauce (mix of white and red wine), and the portion was just right to fill me up.  My mom was so cute and hesitantly asked the waiter to explain some of the dishes.  He was more than happy to do so.  She ordered the spaghetti with pancetta, etc.  Bonus: They have two flat screens at the bar, and the waiter chatted with me about my beloved Giants.  We ended the meal with a passion fruit sorbet--refreshing!  I can't wait to go back to eat and relax again!
author: Steph W.

description:
Take a trip back in time with classic Italian dishes.  I enjoyed the old school feel and the proper tuxedo'd wait staff, white tablecoth's and all.
The food was very good, wait staff friendly and a FULL bar.  
Reminds of the old days as a kid eating in those Italian joints in the North East near NYC, Philly, etc
author: Jeff A.

description: fantastic.  i thought this was my father's kind of place (steak, potatoes, overcooked fish...) Wrong - really delicious, fresh, perfectly prepared and a Real Cocktail as accompaniment.   Yum.
author: Artemis C.

description: When my girlfriend and I sat down at a table her bread plate had a thin layer of yellow grease on it, and both my wine and water glasses had small smudges on them. I scraped a bit of red pasta sauce off my wine glass, and maybe it was butter on my water glass. The reason we stayed though was because the staff was really nice and friendly. The food was pretty good, but I wouldn't say awesome.
author: Matthew J.

description:
If I could give no stars, I would! They are, by far, the worst place I have ever eaten in my entire life. 

I went there to celebration a special occasion and wish I had opened a can of tuna for dinner instead. The food was not fresh and it all  tasted canned. I wasn't famished but the waiter had decided (for me) that he was going to give me (and charge me) for the three course meal. When I had mentioned that was not what I ordered, he argued with me. The salad looked and tasted like vomit, the fish was rank, and I couldn't stomach anything else. The bill was about $20+ a head and no one ate. 

I don't know how they have so many good reviews but if you want to eat your food, go some place else!
author: Dayana C.

description:
Abysmal. I am shocked that this restaurant has received such great reviews so far. I ate here with my boyfriend's visiting family (all of whom LOVE Italian food) on a recommendation from a friend. That friend is now no longer allowed to recommend anything.

I had the pasta primavera, which was among the worst I've ever had. (Seriously, a Michelina's microwave meal would have been more palatable.) The uninspired mix of vegetables (broccoli + cauliflower?) were both soggy and flavorless--I suspect, because they were frozen. The cream sauce was mediocre, though admittedly I've had worse. They only offered one kind of pasta: spaghetti (don't bother asking them to cook it al dente). My fellow diners had cheese ravioli (decent) and beef ravioli (which everyone agreed tasted very much like chef boyardee and was, also, likely frozen). The bread was cold, stale and inedible. Though we were still hungry at the end of the meal, we could not bring ourselves to order dessert, for fear of what we would receive. 

As for the atmosphere....it was like walking into an estate sale in 1963. If the Brady Bunch house had a love child with a swap meet, that child would be this restaurant. I can not fathom how some reviewers deign  to call this place "classy."  The best I can say about the decor is that the dirty doily curtains (hanging from crooked tension rods) perfectly complemented the popcorn ceiling. The stuffed animal head replicas peppering the bar, moreover, really balanced out all the paintings of "the old country." The fact that the waiters are required to wear tuxedos  against this drab and utterly confused setting is all the more troubling (if not laughable).

I will admit, though, that the waitstaff was very, very nice.
author: Catherine T.

description: I usually come dressed up, but I had just come from the beach and I was wearing casual clothes. I noticed a big difference in how nice they were to me. Still good food at a reasonable price, but the difference in service and the fact that no one came by to refill my coke or water makes me want to drop a star.
author: Chris I.

description:
This is my favorite Restaurant in the Parkside Neighborhood. 

For those who go to Marcello's expecting grandiose service and California inspired cuisine are out of their element and should look elsewhere. Marcello's is not part of the Hip San Francisco Restaurant scene, nor does it strive to ever be apart of such a movement. Rather Marcello's is representative of a time when neighborhood establishments where viewed as a place to gather with friends and family for events big and small. A place where people know you, a place to have a formal celebration, or just a rowdy Saturday night with some friends. At Marcello's the atmosphere is always friendly and inviting. 

With all of that being said, not a thing in Marcello's has been updated since the day they opened - including the bus boy. This is not a bad though - it adds to the eclectic ambiance. I also find it ironic at the Italian Establishment that all of the waiters are Irish Immigrants. 

The service is different than one would expect for Bow Tie sporting Irishmen. The waiters and bus boy are a little slow to the draw, but what they lack in speed the make up for in personality and friendliness. You never leave Marcelleo's feeling unappreciated. And furthermore you should not go to Marcello's expecting James Beard Golden Fork Service. 

The food and cocktails at Marcello's are always consistent. I would recommend "Frank's Salad" and the "Veal Marcello". I would also recommend the full service dinner that comes with soup and pasta. The apps are also a good bet as well. Their wine list is weird, but very reasonably priced. You can get a bottle of Jordan Cab for half the price of anywhere else. 

The other night me and a group of 6 of my friends went in for dinner armed with 5 of our own bottles of wine and purchased another 7. I don't exactly remember leaving, and was a little embarrassed to return, for fear that we upset the staff. But much to our surprise, when we returned they bought us a round of drinks and told us that they were glad we were back, 

That is just the kind of place Marcello's strives to be.
author: Jack S.

description:
Hands down the best veal in town.  They have many ways of preparing veal and each is outstanding.  

It's very "old school" but that's not a bad thing in my book, as long as the food is good quality.  

I have been going to Marcello's for decades and I have never had a bad meal.  The veal, as mentioned, is fabulous.  If you can get it with the porcini mushrooms- order it because Marcello, the owner, hunts high and low for the best porcini's.  They also have a dynamite porcini risotto.  I sometimes order that entre as an appetizer for the table.

They offer each meat entre either as a "dinner" selection or "a-la carte."  The dinner menu includes soup or salad- great homemade dressing, pasta, and a decent  portion of the main dish with potatoes and vegetables as a side/ sharing the main plate.

Homemade pasta sauces are all delicious-great palce to have alfredo sauce.

Overall Marcello's is a great place to go if you are out in the sunset and don't want to schlep downtown for old school Italian food.
author: Edmond S.

description:
I came here on a Friday night, and dude, parking was impossible! Holy crap, but luckily, I found parking just a block away! We came in and we were already 30min late for our reservation due to some personal reasons. But the owner was nice enough to let us get the nice table. 

Everyone in here was basically a regular. I felt kind of left out with my boyfriend, not because we were the only young Asians, but because I felt like everyone knew each other. Oh well, that's not going to ruin my night!

Our waiter was pretty nice, however, it took awhile for him to come around to start us off and to take our order. It took him about 20-30min just to come around to greet us. The place was pretty packed as well, but still no excuse to leave us there with our bread crumbs. 

When I finally got the menus, I couldn't read a damn thing but only the ones that are closest to the English language of course! I had to text my brother to translate some of them on google, yeah how pathetic of me! I ended up getting this shrimp dish, and mann, it was bomb diggity! My boyfriend on the other hand, he didn't like his dish at all. He had some chicken leg dish. 

Bottom line is that I wouldn't come back here. I wasn't feeling the atmosphere, and neither was my boyfriend. 

note: about $23 includes, salad/soup + pasta +entree + tea/coffee. That sounds pretty sweet until I found a hair in my pasta......
author: Sandy T.

description:
I'm a bit shocked that some people give this place less than 3 stars.

I've been here twice and I can't think of a single thing that's wrong. The food is great. The service spot-on. The place is clean and the staff are very friendly.

Rack of Lamb was tender. Cheese ravioli was fresh and the sauce was delicious. Full bar and a large wine list. Perfect for date-night or satisfying that craving for some delicious Italian food.
author: Christopher B.

description:
Marcello's is a conundrum. If it were a person, it would be one of those older women you sometimes see that you know used to be really hot.  She still puts on full makeup and gets her hair did twice weekly, wears gaudy jewelry and maybe even some tasteful animal print. She has designer sunglasses. Even though her exterior is kinda tacky, she's somehow so charming and classy in temperament that you can't help but feel intrigued by her.

That's how this place is. It's like someone's throwing a black tie gala in a Holiday Inn from 1967. Charming somehow.
author: Mari C.

description: Funny how I had to wrote a bad review in order for the owner to notice. I went last year close to the end of baseball season and finally have time to write review regarding bad restaurant(s). Were there a rule that I can't write a review in so many month later on a restaurant?  The owner wrote back tried to make some smart @ss remark. Well guess what...you did turn us down when we walk into your restaurant. You were act all cold toward us and didn't even tell us we have to turn over a table in certain time. All you said was, sorry no table, all reserve. We walk into  your restaurant where is was empty, there were only 2 tables with customers. I don't just love good foods, I also look at customer service. Don't worry, I don't mind if my family is not welcome at your restaurant. In anyway, I have to said Thank you. Because you sent us out of the door with your unwelcome attitude.That have give us a chance to enjoy our dinner with a better restaurant where not only their foods was delicious and they truthfully treat all customers like family.
author: Kat S.

description:
For the "Italian Place less Than Two Blocks Away From My Apartment", Ristorante Marcello is indeed, "A-Ok".

Only been here a couple times, both times were with a party of 8 or more.  Me, the bf, and his various family members (Mom, Dad, 3 lil bros and respective significant others).  Each time our dinner was remarkably unmemorable.

Now I don't mean this as a bad thing.  The service wasn't bad, kinda.  It was busy and we did have a rather large party, the average party size was about 4.  Seemed like we were somewhat ignored in getting drink orders and then returning to take our dinner orders, allowing other people to be seated and then order, thus causing our food to TAKE FOREVER to come out (annoying).  But the food was fine, nothing amazing, but decent Italian.  I myself had the Chicken Parmesan, kind of hard to mess up, and they didn't.  But others who order Scallopeni or Piccata were less than thrilled.

If I'm in the mood for Italian, even though I live less than 2 blocks away from Ristorante Marcello's I'd head else where.  Although prices really aren't that bad. Ok, so, if the MUNI was broken and I was drunk and couldn't drive I would def go to Marcello's.
author: Chelsea C.

description: Excellent from start to finish! We moved to the neighborhood 6 months ago and never tried this gem until now-wow! SO good! I started with the carpacio which had a great dijon sauce and capers while my husband had the escargot and both were exceptional.We both had vodka martinis which were lovely. Then, I tried the veal saltimbocca with prosciutto and he had the veal Marcello with a Marsala sauce. For dessert, I had an Italian wedding cake and my husband had strawberries with a grand marnier sauce.Great service and food!
author: Antoinette S.

description:
Marcello as noted by other reviewers is a hidden gem in the outer sunset/park side district. From the outside you would not be able to tell what to expect. My boyfriend and I conjured up weird ideas about this place as you cannot see what awaits you from the outside. Inside, you'll bedazzled by the friendly people, decor, and atmosphere. 

The service is impeccable! Our waiter was a good joker and though I'm a bit shy, he made us feel at ease.
