He was able to give excellent recommendations for our meal and I can't believe he caught me trying to look up the dishes on my iPhone. He was kind enough to ensure me that I was in good hands when it comes inquiring about their Italian dishes.

I have only been to one other Italian restaurant in the city but my boyfriend and I can tell that the food here is delicious without it being overly "arrogant" (right amount of flavor without being over powering or too fancy for my palate.)
You know that old Olive Garden commercial "when your here, your family"? Well Marcello definitely gives out that vibe and the dishes reflect that. The veal scallopini was full of tender veal and mushroom goodness, the flounder nice and flaky with a distinctive white wine taste and their minestrone soup was nice and thick and not too watery kind of way. The meal ended nicely with chocolate truffles that tasted like they were made in the kitchen, rich, velvety and dark.

Definitely 5 stars! The people were friendly, the waiter provided great service! Food, decor is fabulous!
author: L H.

description: Great service and yummy food! Brought my elderly father and they were very accommodating. Will be back solo and with dad again!
author: Kristi N.

description: Marcello has a old fashion classy feel and is a place were you walk in and will feel under dressed if you're going in in jeans. But regardless of how you're dressed they will service you no different than others. Our waiter was friendly and informative. The meal was slightly on the expensive side for what you get. We had the Carbonara, Frutti di Mare, and Veal Eduardo.  Pretty standard type of meal. Tasty like it's suppose to so not a very memorable meal even though the meal was good.
author: Jess H.

description:
I love Ristorante Marcello. It's very homey and the food is awesome. We always seem to get the same waiter and he deals with my indecision about what to get by helping me order. He figures out kind of what I want then fine tunes it. I really love this restaurant. The waiters actually know what they're serving. They can tell you if the fish came in fresh or frozen. They can tell you what's in the sauce and who made the recipe.

It cracks me up to read a couple reviews from people mentioning they got ignored because they dress like slobs. That really makes me like Ristorante Marcello even more... I don't want to go to there and be surrounded by slobs. It's not an fffing pizza joint.
author: Art L.

description:
Went there for the first time tonight with my dad. A slow Tuesday night at about 8pm.
We had a wonderful experience!
He ordered one of the specials of the night, the sea bass with a caper sauce(which he seemed to enjoy). I had the eggplant Parmesan. 

I originally thought this should be a 4.5 star rating. But the place was so nice and hospitable that I decided it deserved to be rounded up to a 5 star rating.
I only say 4.5 because the eggplant Parmesan was a little odd; it had a white sauce under the marinara (which made the eggplant extra soft, but also added a strange gravy-ish flavor). Both dishes came with sliced potatoes (sort of like au gratin) and greens on the side, maybe close to kale greens or something like that. But they were still both good enough dishes that we took the leftovers home.

Very lovely atmosphere. Wonderful waiter and busser, both of them joked around with me and my dad. The busser took my wine glass away as soon as we sat down at the table, which peeved me for a second, but I look younger than my age, and it's not like it hasn't happened before. 

We got the dinner meal with the salad and the pasta, which ended up being so filling that we weren't able to really crack into our entrees. Yes, the entrees did take a while to come out, but I think in general the restaurant is accustomed to people ordering this particular style of meal and allowing time between the courses for digestion.

The atmosphere is very comfortable, with a little bit of class added in. I felt under dressed compared to the wait-staff, but not compared to everyone else in there.

Oh and also they have a wonderful selection of wine!

Sorry this review was all over the place! 
I'd definitely go back because of that atmosphere and would love to try some of their other dishes.

I wish the outside showed more of the character of the inside though, because this place is a gem!
author: Chaslin S.

description:
Marcello's was a flashback experience, a throwback in time to the classic neighborhood Italian eatery. The menu, while extensive, isn't fancy, but features classic Italian dishes. Marcello is quite the mushroom hunter, and if you're lucky, his restaurant will have some fresh mushroom dishes as a special. I had a very nice veal scalopine al funghi with fresh porcinis mushroom; very flavorful with a nice touch of lemon in the sauce.

The place was pretty busy for a Wednesday night and service was a little slow. But our waiter took pretty good care of us otherwise and I'd certainly be happy to go back.
author: Bruce H.

description:
Went here on a recommendation.  It's definitely old school Italian decor and the owner is old school too.  My wife is Italian and we had a hard time placing the region, but she often orders a "staple of chicken piccata" to check things out.  It was well tender, but under seasoned.  My meal was rather bland.  
I'm okay with the decor and the owner seemed like a nice guy, but the service was really poor.  The waiter was good at spin, but as an example of several...They brought my wife her wine at the appetizer and my drink came with the meal.  I'll leave it at that.  I won't seek the place out, but might give it another chance if the stars align..
author: Scott K.

description:
Nice neighborhood restaurant.

Food was very good
Wait staff ho hum; accommodating with orders but not much attention given for that special occasion you may be celebrating. 

Overall, nice restaurant for dinner, fair market prices and comfortable atmosphere.
If I were celebrating an anniversary, birthday, or some other occasion I would go elsewhere.
author: R H.

description: When you're hankering for old school Italian, linen tablecloths, waiters in black ties, head here. Service is great and the food is good.
author: Aaron M.

description:
This place is what you would expect from an italian-esque restaurant in the outer sunset. 

Apparently it's been there for 30-something years, according to the other reviewers, and I think that is absolutely awesome. It's a cute little place inside, it has a homey vibe to it. Lots of mushrooms hidden around the place, not sure what that is about. 

My boyfriend and I were greeted when we walked in by the owner, Marcello. He had kind of a grumpy-grandpa thing going on about him, but seemed to be very friendly with the regulars. Being friends with the regulars is a great way to do business, but not being friendly with the new-comers is a great way to encourage them not to come back.

A couple came in shortly after us and stood in the doorway looking confused, they weren't even acknowledged, and eventually asked if they should just seat themselves. 

Our wait for our table wasn't very long at all, considering it was a Saturday night during dinner time. They seem to do a decent amount of business, and have just the right amount of seating for a Saturday night. I did not see many people waiting for tables after us. 

The food was extremely unmemorable and kinda over priced for what it was. I ordered the baked salmon and my boyfriend ordered the seabass. We were served basically the exact same dish, same stale potato ("fries"?) pieces, the same bland wilted greens with boiled onions in them... and the same sauce on our fish. His had capers on it. 

The best part about the meal was the house pino nior, which they served generously. 

It wasn't a bad experience by any means, the service was a 3 out of five, the wait time was short, the wine was good, and the food was mediocre. 

I likely won't be returning any time soon.
author: Sara L.

description:
Dining here is like getting in a time machine and traveling to a bygone era in San Francisco. 

You'd almost think that cast members from the Soprano's could walk in and sit at the table next to you. In fact, it looked like a few were! A real old school Italian feel here. From the menu (simple typeset and large variety of food selection), the low key atmosphere and consistent personal service we experienced made me visualize a nostalgic yesteryear.

The food is remarkably delicious. And unlike the old-school-era vibe, everything we ordered was a timeless Italian classic. Even for my more discerning foodie partner!

Overall I was impressed with Ristorante Marcello and I recommend it as a must check out restaurant  if your dining in or near the Sunset District of San Francisco.
author: S M.

description:
I really love this place.  It's an old-style Italian restaurant, complete with accented waiters in tuxedos.  (Diners are dressed relatively casually, though!)  Good food, good wine.  Good service.  What else could you possibly need?

The place was relatively crowded on a Tuesday night, which I took as a good sign.  We sat down and were fed bread and butter and water immediately.  Service was quick.  Our meals came with salad which had a great house dressing.  Two of us ordered the special salmon in a champagne sauce, which came with pasta with marinara sauce, served before the entree.  To me, that brings to mind Ragu and noodles, but it was actually really great--ziti with parmesan in a bolognese sauce.  The salmon itself was delicious--cooked perfectly and very tasty--with spinach and potatoes.  I ordered a Pinot Noir to go with the salmon, which was also a great pour One of my fellow diners ordered another special--ravioli with cheese and veal in a red sauce.  Everyone loved their entrees.  Granted, they were specials and we may not be able to order them again--but after food that good, I would order anything that looks good at this place.

For dessert, we split the Creme de Cacao and Creme de Menthe parfaits.  Also delish.

Really, no complaints here.  Entrees were $11-$25, for whatever it's worth.  Great Italian food.  Highly recommended!
author: Erin W.

description: I love the old school feel in here. There are also no windows in here which makes it perfect for clandestine maifioso meetings in the thick fog of the outer sunset. The food is average, nothing special, but the ambiance and vintage atmosphere is the perfect place to sit at the bar and have a Manhattan or other strong throw back drink. The staff is cool and mellow, and there are a few tv's perfect for watching a game. So hit the bar!
author: Chelsey G.

description:
So, remember when you were 8 and your mother sent you into a store and remember how the shop people would glare at you like they just knew you were a shoplifter?  This is how we were greeted by the hostess.   Glare.  Ice. Glare.  Ice.  No smile. No welcome.  Just stomped in the direction of the dining area with 2 menus encrusted with previous diners cruddy finger prints and other mysterious things.   It went downhill from there.

Entrance:  cool looking old school bar area, nice. 

Dining room - everything is painted white, even a formerly beautiful  old fireplace is painted white.  Strange white curtain panels everywhere.  Stark contrast to the bar area.  Airports are more welcoming and warm that this joint.

Looking over the menu we see the white walls speckled with sauces and other crud.  Trying to ignore it . . . .

The menu - old school which is fine, what we were in the mood for.

The food - Every single thing missed to boat    A chicken dish looked like flattened mystery chicken piece with sauce dumped over it and on top of that melted processed cheese.   Avocado salad was slices of avocado with a strange dressing - we never figured out what the little orange bits were (they look like crushed up sushi bar fish roe)  Pasta dish something microwaved from Trader Joe's would have been better - and I don't shop at Trader Joe's or microwave anything. 

Someone recently wrote a review and said the food is "exquisite"  Mama Mia . . . .  I've been to Italy multiple times, I've eaten Italian on both coasts of the U S multiple times, this food is as close to being exquisite as McDonalds.  But then I suppose there are people who adore McDonalds, so wadda I know?   

And so, judging a book by it's cover - would it be too much to ask that they remove the graffiti that's been on the outside of the building for years?
author: Cinnamon Z.

description: Great food, but gnocchi aren't homemade. At least they were honest about it. Otherwise everything was perfect. Real italian food!
author: Saso M.

description:
This is the place to go if you want a truly vintage Italian American dining experience from the 50's and 60's.  The decor hasn't changed a bit for 40 years, the bar deserves some kind of hip retro status (though it is undiscovered as far as I can tell).  The waiters do wear tuxedos and have all the grace and charm you would expect if you went dining with your grandparents. 

Perhaps the most authentic thing in this place is the way they process money.  There are no digital cash registers or credit card terminals here.  It is all done by hand, on paper!  Just like they used to.  

I have even seen some well dressed senior Italian men there with some menacing solidly built bodyguard types in suits - draw your own conclusions :)

The menu is a slice of Italian American food heaven from 50 years ago with all the classics, some of which I haven't seen in a long time like Sole Almandine etc.  The food is good.  And I am sure would have been considered top notch in 1958!  However, food has changed a lot since then, so I am not sure it's really up to snuff with current favorites in this competitive city.  That said I really enjoy the menu and always enjoy my meals with a classic martini or two. 

 Go to Marcello's for the whole experience and you won't be disappointed.  If you lived on the tail end of those times like I did, it will kick your nostalgia glands into full gear.  If you are younger, it will possibly seem foreign and wonderful like something out of a Godfather movie.   Or if you have no sense of retro, it will seem stuffy, dark and mediocre.
author: john h.

description: Wouldn't walk in in jeans and a tshirt (the way I did, ahem). Definitely more of an upscale type place (although reasonably priced for the quality of food). Food was fantastic. And by fantastic, I mean made by some kind of crazy international chef and his team of food specialists, fantastic.
author: Tim B.

description:
This is not a quality Italian restaurant and I can't figure out why people come here...and I know quite a few that eat here regularly.  The restaurant is dated in terms of decor, the crowd is older as well, and there is no music or any kind of atmosphere.  The service was ok but they forgot to bring two items out after being asked a few times.  

They have a full dinner option when you order your meal, which comes with either soup or salad, entree, side of pasta, and tea or coffee.  I think that's a good deal for the price - most plates were in the $21 dollar range.  That would be a good deal IF the food tasked good.  But I was disappointed with the meal.  

The minestrone soup was ok but a bit standard and salty, not restaurant quality.  I ordered fish, which was very think and heavily breaded.  I couldn't taste the fish at all, just the breading and the heavy butter sauce it was in.  The side of sliced potatoes and zucchini were plain and cold.  My Friend had the veal and other types of fish and were not impressed either.  The side of pasta was served with some meat sauce on top and was bland and cold.

basically, we all left feeling unsatisfied with the meal and that we had overpaid for the food/place.
author: Frida C.

description: This is a great Italian restaurant....ideal for those who don't like to leave the Sunset. The waiters are entertaining and you're assured to never leave the place feeling hungry. It's a comfy, friendly place to dine with family. The minestrone soup and gnocchi are my favorites.
author: Bernadette W.

description: This blast from the past is my husbands favorite restaurant in the city.  Now married with children, he took me there on out 2nd date.  To say at first, I was bewildered at his infatuation would be an understatement.  However, overtime this place has grown on me as well.  The staff, which has not changed, is very very nice.  The food which perhaps was a little old school for my snooty tastes has really grown on me and I CRAVED when I was pregnant.  Very consistent and yummy food from an excellent staff with excellent value and relatively easy parking.
author: Slone F.

description: This place was absolutely amazing.  I think part of its charm is the fact the it is completely unassuming from outside.  The decor, atmosphere and food are almost perfect.  It's like you've gone back decades.  The only reason I give it four stars is that the service was pretty inattentive--no one filled my water without me asking first.  They need another bus boy.  Also, the bread wasn't warm.  There's something about an Italian food that demands warm bread.
author: Seth E.

description:
This place is interesting.  Service is good, definitely has an old-world feel to it.  Reminds me of 1930's ganster films.  Even the front door is a non descript black door and there are no windows.  however, this just helps the atmosphere and the food is very good.

The only criticism i have is that my GF ordered a salad and it wasn't the most exciting thing i've ever seen.  Just a bit of lettuce, cucumber and tomato on a plate.  it even had raw mushrooms sprinkled on.

The pasta i had was very good though, tasty, a good sized portion and not overly expensive.  Big menu too, but i usually find that detracts from a restaurant.
author: Chris H.

description: Went into this place not knowing that the attire was dressy, my friends and I got good food, but the bread wasn't even warm and the butter wouldn't melt, so that was a fail. But the drinks are strong and they didn't ID my friend who just turned 21. A lot of mirrors too, and decent service. I've had better Italian food for a better price.
author: Karen D.

description:
Went to Marcello's this past weekend with friends who wanted to have Italian food. They had never been to Marcello's before and are well accustomed to good Mediterranean style foods. 

They loved it! We all had one of the house specialties, the veal Marcella. So, delicious, with plenty of veal and just the right amount of mushrooms and artichokes. The thinly sliced potatoes and streamed spinach was the perfect amount on the plate and mixed well with the Marcella wine sauce. 

The house was full that Saturday night, which I think is an indication that people know the food is good and at a affordable price. 

The dinner price is a good value as you get choice of soup or salad with a side serving of pasta for the day. And then a cup of coffee or tea at the end of the meal. Dessert is separate. 

We shared the creme brulee, a very rich and satisfying custard with caramel sauce. 

Parking is not easy to find along Taraval Street. L-Taraval trolley stops a nearby. Best to call to see if reservations are needed on weekends because house gets full quickly and there can be a wait. 

Still a good value and a neighborhood favorite with friendly staff and atmosphere.
author: Jonathan F.

description:
I have been going to Marcello's since as long as I can remember.  It was one of my dads' favorite spots.  Marcello himself is usually there to greet you when you come in with his warm smile.  The food is quite excellent, some of my family's faves are the shrimp Marcello, shrimp covered in bread crumbs, rosemary, and cheese, the house salad has a wonderful hand made dressing made with fresh herbs, the Calamone, calamari prepared like abolone in a light batter with lemon sauce, the chicken ferri garlic and herbed chicken, the peppered corned steak to name a few.

Also as several other yelpers have said the wait staff is very good. They ware tuxedos just like the waiters at OJ's on Taylor used to.  They are attentive and can offer some good tips on wine and daily specials.  Marcello's is definitely one of San Francisco's special spots.
author: Pat C.

description: This is an old school Italian restaurant.  Be expected to see some old folks wearing fur coats here.  Service is quick and friendly.  Prices are reasonable.  Portions are generous. Server has good understanding of the menu.  Waiter never pushed us to open a bottle of wine even we came as a group.  Food were great.  We ordered rack of lamb, New York steak, pasta, grilled salmon .... everyone seems to be happy with what they had.  Be sure to make a reservation.  They get busy all the time.  The night we came they had some kind of wine tasting thing going on.  They had complimentary cheese and strawberries to go with the wine.  The only thing I think they need to pay attention is the dinnerware.  It's a bit out of style.
author: J L.

description:
My family and I have been eating here once or twice a year since I was six. So that's about 16 years, for anyone who's keeping track.

The food is always impeccable. My dad always gets the Veal Lombatina, and my mom says the shrimp scampi is to die for. I am a huge, huge fan of their homemade tortellini with meat sauce.

Oh. Oh, my goodness. I almost forgot. Their minestrone soup. Oh. Don't even get me started. I can chug that stuff. I can't even...I don't even know how to explain how wonderful it is.

The waiters can be a little pushy, but they relax a little if you joke with them. A lot of those waiters have been there since I was small.

I think I'll be going to Marcello's for the rest of my life.
author: Cara B.

description: This place is fantastic! Both times we have eaten there, we showed up without a reservation and were welcomed warmly. The food is fantastic...don't miss their house salad, with the dressing. It's so good you want to lick the plate. The pasta is fantastic and plentiful, unlike the trendy "new" Italian restaurant. I LOVE their linguine vongole is amazing. One day I hope to make it to  dessert as I am sure that is terrific too.
author: Simone D.

description:
Time tested and time honored. I've eaten here numerous times. Sometimes the service is a little slower than others, but it's always been, at worst, good. Love the food, love the atmosphere, and love the clientele.  Some of the regulars have more stories than you can finish drinks. Great stuff from the old days.

The pan fried calamari is to die for, as is the house salad. They make a martini like it should be, and there's nothing *healthy* on the menu. It just doesn't get any better. 

And, another word on the service. I was entertaining a group of six from out of town. At the last minute, everyone wanted genuine Italian. I called, they recognized me, and said they'd work us in. We arrived an hour later to a very busy restaurant. 45 minutes later we were seated. I have no idea how they did it. If service was a little slow for you that night, my apologies. My friends from Chicago and NYC still talk about how great Marcello's is.
author: Harry M.

description: Marcello's has become one of our haunts to go to on Saturday ....better get a reservation because they are very busy.  Never have had a disappointing meal there...the staff are very accommodating....and friendly....It is a nice place for a couple to eat at when it is a special occasion...they don't rush you at all...
author: Patti L.

description:
I only live a block away and have been reading about it on Yelp, but it was only tonight that I decided to actually go in and take a look.

I think the first thing I noticed was that the restaurant was not as dark as I had expected and somewhat noisier.  Also, the crowd was a lot younger than I'd expected from the other reviews, but then again, it IS Feb. 14.

Came in at the same time as another couple, no reservations, at 9PM, and I think we were all seated within 15 minutes, which wasn't bad.

The complimentary bread was typical for restaurants of this type, but I liked the butter.  For the main course, I got a rack of lamb, which was one of the specials.  It came with 8 pieces of lamb and some potatoes and cucumbers.  It's a good thing I didn't order the full special which would've come with soup/salad and pasta, or I don't think I could've finished it all.  But I do want to try those, maybe next time (I was also sick, so my appetite wasn't fully there)

Special things of note:

The waiter noticed my Cal jacket and said Go Bears! when I went in, and also as I left. +$1 tip
He made more conversation and jokes than 99% of the restaurants I've been to, which was great!  More waiters should do that.  +$1 tip
He didn't make a comment or stare at my very... untraditional date.  +$1 tip

So I think I ended up overtipping by 20% or so.  But I do expect to go back in the future, preferably with a more traditional date so I consider it a good investment (sorry, weighted companion cube, but I do expect my date to speak to me...)
author: Yeh F.

description:
It's been said before but it should be said again - the "old school" atmosphere of Marcello's holds a lot of its charm. The staff is friendly and relaxed, the menu broad enough to satisfy any italian craving and priced really decently considering the whole package. If you're really hungry try one of their dinners - comes with soup or salad, pasta del giorno (usually bolognese) and coffee for about $25. The waiters take the time (when they can) to get to know you and I've been hearing something lately I never thought I would in a city - "The usual?" 

Definitely a San Francisco gem that I hope is around for years and years to come.
author: Mindful Indulgence S.

description:
- Outside not inviting but inside looks nice.
- Good marinara sauce
- Good portions
- Service was very good.
- Get the Strawberry sunset dessert 
- "Never go against the family"

I don't think I would've even bother trying this place out if it wasn't for several Yelp reviews. The outside of the restaurant doesn't compare to how it looks inside. The place has no windows to look at until you take a peek inside.

This Italian restaurant is truly a throwback of what all Italian restaurants used to be. The servers are wearing bow ties and tuxes. The decor has a classy Italian feel.

In some way i felt a bit under dressed with my jeans and t-shirt but after sitting down, I noticed nearly everyone was dressed casually.

We ordered spaghetti primevera and the roasted leg of lamb dinner. The red pasta sauce was very tasty. It's obviously hand made. It didn't have the  typical overwhelming tomato sauce you usually get from other places.  The lamb wasn't what I expected (it wasn't on a bone) but it was still tasty. The portions were just right to even fill up my hungry appetite.

For dessert we had the strawberry sunset. It has strawberries with ice cream spiked with some alcohol- quite good!

The service was very attentive and were on the ball with anything we needed. Great service.

On our way out I noticed there were old school peep holes on the entrance door. I thought wow... I feel like in a "Godfather" Movie.
author: Bert T.

description:
I have an opportunity to try this restaurant, taking date in a foggy night.  Even though I did not make a reservation (because I wanted her to choose which restaurant to go), the owner allowed my date and me to be seated in a short time.  

I ordered a Cros Du Val Merlot as she liked red, but I thought that wine would not be versatile with almost any dish.  My prediction was right, as it was smooth enough to be complimented with my ravioli and her veal/mushroom dishes, yet characterful enough to be enjoyed on its own.  

She wanted to have escargot, so we tried.  That was the first time for me (and her) to be served with escargot tongs.  I was somehow able to grab a shell with it, but she had a hard time.  It was very cute, and of course I let her eat it by bare hand ;).  Oh, the escargot was tasty with pasto-like sauce.

I ordered angle cake, while she ordered sandae.  She definitely enjoyed the food, and the service.  The old woman who was sitting next to us told us that we were a cute couple.  I know I know, that obviously skewed my rating, but what can I say...?
author: Tak K.

description:
Best Italian in the city, now that the Gold Spike is no more.  A great place to take a date on a weeknight when all you've got planned after dinner is a cocktail and some bed-wrestling.

Reservation times are a bit flexible but the bar is a very well-stocked and comfortable place to wait.

Edit: I went back this week for the first time in maybe a year and the service sucked.  The waiter came by twice in the first five minutes to take our order and we told him we needed a few minutes still.  Then we didn't see him for a good while.  He was friendly, as usual, and we weren't too put out.  But it also took him forever to drop the check.  I used to wait tables so it's a peeve for me.  So Marcello looses a star.

The food was still excellent, but maybe I've got more dining out experience and now I think it's a little spendy for what you get.  The bill was over a hundo for two people with a bottle of wine and no dessert.  And as good as it was, I've had better.  With so many other Italian spots in the city, I don't think it stands up.  Damn.  Down to three stars.

All that being said, I'll probably end up there for some family thing some time and it'll be better.  And I'll take this all back.
author: Jimmy C.

description:
I've passed by here probably a bazillion times before in my life and have never had any urge to go inside.  The outside seemed very lonely and boring.

I finally decided to come here after reading great reviews on yelp!

Inside was very much different than the outside.  It was LIVELY and full of people deep in conversation.

Bf and I were quickly seated in between to pairs of couples.  It was kinda close, but still I had my own little space.  I sat on the long couch, and all the ladies separated each other with their handbags.  

I had the deluxe dinner, veal special; bf had the seafood pasta and clam chowder.

All the hype about the butter and house salad......it was just regular butter, and just a house salad.  My meal also came with a penne meat pasta, that was yummy.  My veal indeed was tender, but not very flavorful covered with too much sauce.  I dont know what kind of veggies I had, but they were very soft.  potatoes were a thumbs up.  

Bf's clam chowder was wonderful!! 
However, his seafood pasta was kinda 50/50.  The pasta was good, sauce was good, but the clams were rotten.  Like you couldnt see it, but you could taste it.  They were UBER fishy tasting, and was not edible.

We did not complain, service was TOO nice to complain.  

One waiter in the yellow asked us, "shui?" meaning water in chinese, and then said "xie xie" meaning thank you.  It was kinda racist, but also very funny!! 

At the end of the meal, the waiter forgot my cappuccino and later brought me a dessert on him.  

OKAY, i gave this restaurant 3 stars as I was writing this review, but now that i recapped how much i liked the waiters and service, 4 stars it is.
author: kim w.

description:
Fancy?  No.
Innovative? No.

The restaurant has been around since 1979.  It doesn't look like they've changed anything since.  It's more than a little bit worn and slightly kitschy.  

The reason you go to Marcello's?  The food.  It's simple but they do it WELL.

My Italian grandfather dropped out of school when he was in the 4th grade and cooked his entire life.  He was a fantastic cook.  

Here's what I'll say:  My mom ordered the Minestrone soup.  She took a bite and said that it tasted so much like nonno's she wanted to cry.  My dad and I each tried it and we concurred.
author: T M.

description: Excellent pasta and meat dishes, generous portions and a solid wine list. Marcello's is a dependable classic and their minestrone is about as authentic as it gets.
author: Matt G.

description:
Many of my good friends are in the 70 & up age bracket. They all swear by Marcello's. A place must be good if you've gone there for 20 years straight. No one keeps a pricey habit on a pension unless it's worth it! It hails from the same camp as Joe's of Westlake, but dare I say it-- the food is better. 

Marcello's does have an old school feel, and by old school I mean: class. The decor is comfy, like you're in the large living room of someone you really like and the service staff are excellent. They make you feel like the place is yours. Take time to get a story out of your waiter on a slower night (which isn't often in this neighborhood haunt), there's something fun up his sleeve!

I've taken large groups there on multiple occasions, and the service is always perfect. I agree with the rating below, it is a perfect place to take family, or friends who are family.
author: Erin A.

description:
Old school Italian restaurant. 
We had reservations for dinner and arrived a few minutes early. We were told that it was going to be a few minutes until our table was going to be ready. We camped out at the bar and had a drink while waiting. A few minutes turned into 45 minutes and we saw several other people being seated before us. The food was good and the drinks were strong but based on the long wait I probably wont be returning
author: Bumble B.

description:
Tony Soprano walks in for a "family" dinner. At the bar are the Black Donnellys with their crew. A Beck look-a-like accompanied by a dark-haired Kirsten Dunst look-a-like. The rest of the patrons are from the movie Cacoon with a Driving Miss. Daisy thrown in. Marcello's is kitch-o-rama. One walks in from the darkness that is Taravel St. to a burst of energy and interior only found ...well ..at  the Madonna Inn or a Jersey Lounge. All the same, with so much charisma, it's a pity that the food can't match. 

What can you expect from a night at Marcello's? A crowd of seventy-somethings, slow service, good energy, nice staff, fair Italian family-style food, and ...the reason to go... throwback interior with throwback Martini's!! 

The wait staff dress in dinner jackets, evoking a by-gone era befitting a 1940's cruise ship line. Though I wish their food was closer to that of Delfina, you can't buy this kind of atmosphere anywhere.
author: Johnny C.

description:
I was craving some Italian last Friday night, but was too lazy to travel far for it and definitely not up for Olive Garden. I just wanted some seafood pasta in a nice wine sauce. So as the BF and I thought of Italian places in the Sunset, this was pretty much the only place we could think of besides OG. We'd driven past this place a million times but it always looked closed.

So after doing a quick yelp search on my trusty iPhone, we decided this place might be worth trying. And I'm glad we did. This is not an out of this world good Italian joint, but it is good. BF ordered the chicken saltimbocca and I had the spaghetti di (del? something starting with a "d") mare, the seafood pasta I craved. 

The Good:
-The service--our waiter was very nice and kept offering me generous portions of parmesan for my pasta, which I accepted as I like lots of cheese on my pasta but I didn't want to seem like a piggy asking for that much cheese.
-The atmosphere--just like other yelpers said, it feels like a restaurant our of an italian-American mobster movie. A la The Godfather or the Sopranos, which is perfect for BF, who dreams of eating Carmella Soprano's cooking and recites lines from Scarface. Our waiter with his accent sounded like he was a Sopranos character. 
-Food was good. My pasta wasn't quite as wine-y tasting as I like for my seafood pasta to be. but it satisfied my craving. Saltimbocca dinner came with a side of pasta, salad or soup, side of veggies and potatoes.
-Parking's easy to find.

The Bad:
-Price. Price is reasonable the pastas, from $12-16, but it was $20 for the meat dinners. I think it's a little cheaper minus the side of pasta and salad, but still.

So 5 stars
-1 star for good but not spectacular food deserving 5 stars
-1 star for prices just barely within my budget
= 3 stars, but I would eat there again should I have a pasta craving while in the Sunset. Or if the BF ever feels like pretending to be Tony Soprano.
author: Jessie C.

description:
I have been eating and getting food to go from Marcello's for over six years now and I have been a very loyal customer. Last night, I got a chicken liver dinner and eggplant parmigiana dinner to go and I have to say that I was quite disappointed with the quality of the food.


 I mean I just didn't feel the usual love! Where is the love?


 The salad didn't have as much mushed-up goodness, and my chicken livers were dark and freaky looking, and not very delish.


 I certainly hope this is just a fluke. An off night, perhaps.
author: henriettaol

description:
I am so excited about this place.  It's close to where we live, and it was excellent tonight!  I mean, I have been waiting for years to come across a veal piccata like this one.  Unbelievably lemony and tender!  The salad that I got was crazy good- it had fresh avocado, shrimps, hearts of palm, radish, carrot, and crisp lettuce.  I already want more of everything.  My husband's sea bass was so tender, I couldn't believe it.  I usually only like the endangered sea bass (Chilean).  Bread was fresh and yummy, and what they called gelato for  dessert really was gelato.  (not ice cream trying to pass for gelato)  I love this restaurant and can't wait to go back and maybe try a pasta dish.

Oh yeah, the atmosphere is definitely "old school", but I see nothing wrong with that.  The waiters were charming and friendly, and we were clearly surrounded by patrons who were very happy to be there- young and old.
author: Allison A.

description:
Let me start by saying we got here at 7pm on a Thursday when most of the neighborhood was out of power. So apparently everyone went to Marcellos. It was very noisy. Lively, happy diners, so it was a good thing, but my old mom was impossible to converse with. So that was slightly annoying. But its not anything I'm lowering the stars for.
   My mom got the chicken picatta, which she really liked. It looked very homestyle, and it was a good amount of food. I got the pesto tortellini, which was okay. I don't know if what I want is impossible, but I am constantly looking for a pesto dish that isn't suuuuper oily. I know pesto is oil based, but I just love the basil & garlic flavours & wish there wasn't a big pool of oil at the bottom of the bowl when I was eating. I understand it, but its just unappetizing. Eh. 
   We shared the tiramisu for dessert....it was not good. I am saddened by this. The restaurant seemed traditional Italian, so I figured the tiramisu would be super amazing. Of course I'm not Italian : /  It was kinda rubbery & tasted a bit stale, and I expected the liquor flavouring, which didn't deliver. Boohoo.  
   For my pesto tortellini & tiramisu, I would give 2 stars. But since my mom really enjoyed her chicken picatta, 3 it is. Meh.
author: Dakota M.

description: Marecello's has fantastic food,we have been going to them for a lot of family functions.  They know how to cook their food perfectly.  My favorite is the calamari steak and their special salad with the artichoke hearts is really yummy!  Hope they stay there for a very long time,so I can bring my grandchildren someday.  Thank you!
author: Annalisa M.

description: Terrible service. They'll only take care of you if you're a large party. Parties of two are automatically ignored. Guess they know what they're doing since they've been around for a while. Can't comment on the food since they never bothered to take our order after waiting for a while and being "too busy" to serve us. What a shame.
author: H I.

description: What can I say - if you're looking for classic, old world Italian food, you can't do much better than Ristorante Marcello.  A friend from work introduced us to this place (she grew up in the neighborhood) and it was a wonderful surprise.  Taraval can be a busy street, and from the outside it doesn't look like much of a place.  But wait until you get inside.  Marcello himself greets and seats you.  The waitstaff are all dressed up in tuxes and very professional, and the food is classic Italian food.  I had the chicken parm and it was wonderful.  Not too breaded, lightly sauced with a nice amount of cheese.  Served with a nice house salad, pasta, veggies and potatoes, and coffee.  What a wonderful treat to find such a nice place in such an unlikely spot.  I'd definitely go back if I found myself over there around dinner time.  Lot's of other things on the menu I'd like to try.
author: Dan S.

description: This place is old school San Francisco Italian. The food is good and they have all of the more interesting dishes like frog legs (which are fantastic) and shortbreads. This alone means big ups from me. The pasta sauce is great, as is the minestrone, and their profiteroles are incredible. The service is fantastic and the characters in this place are classic San Fran. Basically I'm here every time I'm in the city and I'd recommend it to anyone.
author: Matthew L.

description:
I went for dinner with friends last night & must say that I was less than impressed. I haven't been to Marcello's in a long time & last night reminded me of why. We waited 15 minutes to be seated for our reservation & then had to wait another 30 before anyone came to take our order. By the time the waiter came to take orders, we'd all forgotten what the specials were and had to ask what they were again, which really pissed them off. That's what they get though for reading the specials & letting you sit for 10 minutes before coming back to take orders. 

The place was insanely hot & they only brought water for half our party. When we asked for more they said they couldn't because they didn't have any clean water glasses.... bring it in a fucking coffee cup I don't care... 

The food was good, but hardly & I mean HARDLY top notch.

Given that it's way out in B.F.E and plays host to the blue haired ladies society I think it's safe to say the place is way past its prime.
author: Dan C.

description: Not every plate will come out the same. My linguini had plenty of clams, but barely Any sauce. My friend order the same thing n had plenty of sauce. Great service though, so the stars are basically for the service
author: kiki L.

description:
Think about "The Godfather" when you come to this place.  Marcello's serves traditional Tuscan-Italian cuisine.

We stumble upon this place when we were looking for another Italian restaurant on Taraval.  We didn't find it, so we decided to try Marcello's.
They almost turned us away because it was packed and we didn't have a reservation, but some people left and we had a table.  The guy did say that they get busy, so reservation is recommended.  

My finance had the homemade cheese ravioli, in a white sauce.  This was extremely good dish.  It was rich and creamy, but not too cheesey.  It was perfecto!  The bread is ok, but their butter is really good.  I had the wild salmon in champange sauce.  This was damn good. Although this item was one of their specials for the night.  

Food was excellent.  Services was great. Butter was heaven.  I would highly recommend Marcellos.
author: Nam N.

description: Been going here since the late 70's with my parents before the Gold Mirror became a tired joke.   Love this place, mostly for the seafood specialties and spaghetti carbonara (when I fell like being especially bad with my diet)  casual atmosphere.
author: Sfgpgirl G.

description:
This place is great. Good portions on the food. The staff is always friendly and they all have been there for years. I used to live down the street and would go here pretty frequently. I left town for a couple years and one of the first things I did when I came back was take some friends out to Marcellos. Has an old school feel to it. 

Park the car close because you won't be able to walk very far after getting the dinner here.
author: jared c.

description:
Decided to try this place out on suggestion from a guy at the local bar I go to from time to time!

I loved it! It totally reminded me of the places I went to with my parents growing up in New Jersey! It's like walking into an episode of The Sopranos. Old, east coast style, traditional Italian restaurante. 

The waiter was awesome! The service very good!

The bread was nothing special, great butter! The salad was awesome! Awesome being traditional Italian style overly dressed vinegarette. The Veal was delicious! The greens were kind of strange but otherwise it was basic!

This place is good but I could see where most west coast hipsters wouldn't like it! On the contrary I could see myself hiding in the corner of this place on from time to time!
author: Elle G.

description: Good Wine, real butter, good service!!!!  What more is there...  Great old world atmosphere with a nice bar and great bartender...  The hostess could use a lesson on customer service, but that is not enough to skip this neighborhood gem!!!
author: B M.

description:
We have been long time fans of Marcello's.  It is an oassis in the Sunset for dining and a gem in San Francisco over all.  Dining at the tables is always great, but even more fun is having a less formal dinner experience eating at the bar.   A great bar-they really know how to make a martini.  Some of our favorite dishes are Frank's salad-I would love to know how they make that dressing-the salad is filled with avacado and shrimp, delicious.  Another must try is Prawns Marcello-fresh prawns baked in a scalloped dish covered with the most wonderful breading...go just for those two items...go back to try the rest of the menu, cuz it's all good.  Great pastas, a wonderful pepper steak and so much more.   Like I said, we are long time fans...check it out.
Kelly
author: skippy M.

description: Love it!  Any place with tuxedoed waiters has alot going for it off the bat!
author: Michael D.

description:
I brought my friend here for her birthday as she loves old style Italian.   The highlight of the evening was the prawns appetizer which was so tasty I could have ordered it as an entire entree.  Unfortunately, the dining experience only got worse.  

The house salads tasted like they were prepared in advance and left sitting in the fridge case too long.  Blech.  The veal piccata was overcooked and underseasoned, while the eggplant parmigiana was bitter and rubbery.  The sauce was watery and didn't taste fresh.  

Whatever you do, don't come for the first dinner seating or be prepared to gobble down and get out within an hour.  Before we even had a chance to order a birthday dessert, they were trying to scoot us out the door.  Our table was seated near the host station and he kept pointedly telling a waiting couple that he was waiting for our table.   The host was some old guy - don't know if it was the owner or not - but shame on him.  It wasn't like we were hanging out for hours sipping water.  

In hindsight, I would have skipped the aggravation of ordering dessert which tasted stale.  I have had better out of the frozen dessert section in the supermarket.  

Wish I had taken my friend to the Gold Mirror down the street instead.
author: Mary C.

description: my sister-in-law hosted her rehearsal dinner at the restaurant where her now-husband's parents had their first date. definitely sentimental! the staff was very kind and was able to run things pretty smoothly. our meal was pretty standard, but it was a great place to host a celebration.
author: Marjie T.

description: Ok first off, if you go there at the right time, the doors might be closed, but it's actually open, you need to open the door. Once inside, it's a nice place and all, but this is NO OFFENSE to Caucasian people, but that place was FILLED with Caucasian  people. I think my friend and i were the only ones there who were not Caucasian. It was very awkward, because firstly, i didn't know what kind of place it was, and the attire my friend and i were in, probably wasn't up to their standards. BUT, overall for the SHORT time we were there, the waiter was very nice, the service was very nice, the place was clean and such. I think if we didn't feel so awkward, and if we had known what the things on the menu actually were, we would have stayed.
author: Ernest C.

description: The food was terrible. The meat sauce tasted like salted dog food with off brand, old tomato paste. The fish that my girlfriend got smelled like a fish packing plant in the summer and tasted like sardines mixed with feet. It made both of us slightly ill. They bait and switched my girlfriend from the al la carte pasta to the meal, then tried to charge for the salad that they brought us that we didnt order and didnt eat(because it was gross) and tried to justify it. The prices were outrageous for the school lunch quality of the food. All of this was on valentines day no less. Ignore the positive reviews, they are either people who work there or people who got extremely lucky. This is simply the worst dining experience of my life. I wish we had gotten frozen pizza's at trader joes and just stayed home.
author: joshua b.

description: Oh Marcello's, how I dream of your minestrone soup every night. No for real though, they have the best minestrone I have ever had......I always try to get the recipe from our waiter but to no avail. My fiance and I have been going to this restaurant a few times a month for the last few years and love it dearly. While I can say that the restaurant can do with a little updating on the decorating side, it has a great atmosphere and everybody is so warm and friendly. The food is awesome and the drinks are good, how can you beat that?! Hands down its the best restaurant in the sunset.
author: Ashley M.

description:
one of the BEST restaurants ever. the veal parmigiana is top-notch, their other choices are so delectable but too numerous to name. the pepper steak will knock your socks off ! all the waiters are wonderful, especially Patrick -- I would marry him if he wasn't already ;-)

the bar is well-stocked, well-manned, and well-visited by moi !
author: Prima D.

description: i have been going here for every special occasion I can remember since i was just a kid and it never changes the waiters and the food are always the same, exceptional!  If you like shrimp try the scampi you won't be disappointed  it's the best!
author: Rosie C.

description: This is another restaurant my grandmother and I go to (we have a dance card of about five restaurants we go to for dinner), but we don't go nearly often enough. The parking is extremely difficult. As I have said before, it is hard to find parking in the Sunset, and this restaurant doesn't have a parking lot, so my grandmother likes to park in the driveway of the nearby auto body shop, since they're closed when we go. I order the same thing every time I go. So far this is the only place I have been to that knows how to prepare veal. Normally, veal isn't something I would have even tried, let alone even admit to eating, but once you've had it here, you'll understand. Compared to Marcello's, I think other restaurants serve regular beef (or whatever the heck it's called) and try to pass it off as veal. I can't comment on the prices because Nana pays when we go out, but I can say the service has been consistently excellent over ten years. Although they're usually packed when we get there, I think we only had to wait once for a table, and that time we sat at the bar and had a drink. It has a neighborhood feel at the bar but feels slightly classier in the tables section, perhaps because there are steps up to the tables? Elevation = superiority? At times it can be a little loud, but I'm usually too busy eating to care.
author: Ivy R.

description: Been here a couple times for dinner. The ambiance is like a classic Italian dinner-house. I always tend to stick with Caesar or hearts or romaine, the spaghetti Bolognese, the panzotti, spicy spaghetti all'amatriciana, a gigantic veal chop or pollo ai ferri for my main choices. I always make reservations so I usually don't have to wait long to be seated.
author: Juliane N.

description: So I decided to try Marcello's just because I wanted Italian around my neighborhood. I was expecting a lot from this place. But no, it was horrible. I was not happy at all. I ordered the Spinach Salad and Clam linguine. My boyfriend ordered the New York Steak which came with soup and pasta. As our soup and salad arrived, the waiter asked if we wanted Parmesan Cheese on dishes. Mistakenly, he was only referring to my boyfriend who had soup. My bf told him "the lady would like parmesan cheese on her salad". The waiter goes and says "Oh but this isn't for salad." Well, excuse me, I like parmesan cheese on my salad. THANK YOU. My clam linguine came and as I glanced at it, I already knew that it wasn't going to be good. The linguine was so dry and plain.. I had to ask for lemon to give it some more taste. The waiter refills our water and says water in Chinese. Really though? Was that necessary? What if I wasn't Chinese? Gee..I was being stereotyped.. I don't think I will be coming back again. Their service and food did not satisfy me.
author: Stephanie L.

description: I LOVE this place.  Old school Italian at it's finest.  Very friendly place.  The food is FANTASTIC.  Be sure to get the minestrone.  I really can't say enough good things about Marcello's.  I'm a lifelong patron for sure.  I'm so happy I found this place.
author: Jeffrey G.

description: we love this restaurant! We have been going here for years and never have had a bad meal. It is consistently good. Their minestrone soup is the best I have ever had. There is nothing not to order on their menu. Every time I have visitors in town we go here. Marcelo is a REAL Italian chef from Italy and he knows how to cook. I find this place to be good and reasonably priced. This place is popular so be sure to make reservations. Absolutely the best Italian in the area, so I highly recommend it. You will not be disappointed.
author: Paula C.

description: The Sunset is filled with little old Italian men, if you know where to look.  You can find loads of 'em at Marcello on a Sunday night...er...a Sunday later afternoon-like maybe 4PM.  Marcello is an original, the spaghetti del mare is wonderful, as is the gnocchi, and you must try the Frank's salad.   My dad drives an hour to get that salad...he pretends to want to see me, but really it's the bay shrimp and house dressing.  Um.
author: Rachel D.

description:
3 stars and no more.  
This is an ordinary family style Italian restaurant. with ordinary food.
The Rack of Lamb was very tender and they gave 7 ribs, but it was over seasoned with pepper and rosemary. The New Years eve night prix fixe dinner was $60.00. per person.  All it did was force you to eat items you don't normally want. The small plate of  tortellini were fair - and nothing to brag about with ordinary sauce on it.t. The house salad with shrimp had a good dressing but it drenched the lettuce leaves - Then the dessert....the choc mouse cake was okay and didn't have  much flavor and seemed generic like something you'd find in the supermarket freezer section. The ice cream with fresh strawberries with amaretto was the most refreshing. For two, the bill came to $135.00 the 3 course dinner + dessert and two cokes, no wine, no drinks.  It was not worth that price as the quality and taste was inferior. We're Italian, know Italian food and this just didn't cut it for us. Wait staff were very nice and the service was pretty good. Coffee was weak and just okay. I don't think we would go back.
author: Girly Foodie F.

description: Marcello is an ok Italian restaurant in the Outer Sunset. It seems to cater to an older clientele, so my group and I felt out of place. The waitstaff are all in tuxes, which can seem slightly pretentious, but they are friendly. The decor is not as stuffy as I imagined; the main dining room was bright and pretty airy. The reason I'm giving Marcello three stars is because of the food. I didn't find anything impressive, except maybe the calamari steak that my sister ordered. I ordered eggplant parmesan and minestrone soup, and neither were tasty or anything special. Frankly, I think I could get the same stuff from the Olive Garden.
author: Cee J.

description: We were in search of  old school Italian restaurants.  First impression was great.  Large bar area, old school decor, waiters in bow ties.  From there we moved on to strong cocktails, very friendly service and excellent food.  I've seen places like this described as somewhere your grandma would take you.  Hey, I loved all my grandma's (long story) and yeah they probably would have taken me to Marcello's and we would have had a great time - plus now I get cocktails.  Cheers Grandma!
author: Jeff J.

description: My amazing aunt and her husband took me and my husband here and it was unforgettable.  You would never know how special this place is from the outside, it looks like nothing special (but that's part of the fun), but inside such a different story.  Wonderful atmosphere and equally wonderful food.  Order the salmon!  A truly remarkable restaurant.
author: Whitney W.

description: Food was tasty, service was not. Guy was nice, but we waited way too long to order drinks and because that took forever, we were ready to order food but he walked away right after getting the drink order & didn't come back for another 6 minutes. We got our food quick, but I ordered just a chicken breast for my son when I saw the prices & I asked if they could do just a chicken breast b/c my son doesn't eat anything else; our server said yes. You'd think he should have added "but you still have to pay for the whole entree" so that the check wasn't a surprise at the end. Nobody came to see how our meal was, nobody was even around to pull aside to refill our waters, so we had no water half-way thru the meal. We ordered dessert, after he finally noticed we were finished with our meals & that was served quickly, again, which is great, but why does it take forever for the server to figure out that his table needs something? Like the check? Isn't dessert the last thing someone orders? Then the surprise of my son's chicken breast, which cost $17.50. WTF. I called ahead of time to make sure this was a family-friendly restaurant, which clearly it wasn't. Maybe the lady who answered the phone thought I was asking about if it was ok to bring my grandparents, not my child. Because everyone was definitely at least 40 years older than me. The decor matches the clientele & the wait staff probably moves slow to support the pace of their regulars. We only chose to eat here because I didn't want to drive all the way to Fisherman's Wharf for some clam chowder. I should have turned around the minute we walked in.
author: Lachelle J.

description: This place is SO random.  I was dragged here by friends who'd just moved to the Sunset.  We walked in, not knowing what to expect, and we were really out of place.  Marcello's is really old-school, both in decor and demeanor; the kind of Italian place where the waiters wear tuxedos, and almost yell at you for not talking fast enough.  Customer service is kind of non-existent, but food is ok. I imagine it's a good neighborhood go-to for Italian, but definitely not worth trekking all the way out to the Sunset.
author: Emily M.

description: THE BEST RESTAURANT EVER!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! this is one of my favorite restaurants in the sunset. i absolutely love their house salad and pasta. MMMMMMMMm and their veal, my mouth is watering as i type. lol. this place is a must. i plan on going here this coming weekend.
author: bridge A.

description:
Two friends and I met at Marcello's thinking it was quite good in the past years.
My friends ordered Tortellini, Fillet of Sole and a Palm heart salad to share (which came up as an artichoke heart salad as the server had not listened carefully so it went back). 
I ordered one of the specials of that Friday night: Rack of Lamb! I ordered it med-rare. I was looking forward to it.  When it arrived it was already sliced to each rib. I took one bite, did not taste like any other lamb I ever ate. I am a Mediterranean I know lamb! Hello, it was BRINED!!
If anyone ever ate brined lamb ribs or any kind of lamb I would like to know where so I will not go there! My friends tasted it as well, one of whom does not like lamb even she agreed that it tasted nothing like lamb.
I was and am very disappointed.. Tortellini was good, I tasted it, so were the potatoes and the vegetables which came with my  "BRINED RACK OF LAMB". I did not want to spoil the evening, did not send it back, just gave it to the sweet Golden Retriever Ruby (minus the bones).
If you ever order lamb at Marcello's please ask if it is brined and insist on finding out or just skip it!
What a disappointment!
author: Yasmine S.

description: I went in for dinner and didn't particularly care for the entree but didn't want to make a fuss.  Soon, Marcello comes to my table, yells at me and tells me to never come back.  I've never had such an experience as this and promise to not go back.  Customers should not be insulted just because they don't care for the food.
author: Robin S.

description: The food was alright. The ones I went with praised it. But I guess I'm more of an Americanized Italian fan. The busser was charming. Our server had the smile on, but barely gave us any service. And he wrongly charged a dessert from the table next to us on our bill. He had a smile on the whole time though, so I give him that. I don't think I'm likely to come back. Oh yeah, one downer is that the whole menu is in Italian with no english descriptions. That caused a bit of hassle.
author: Elaine H.

description: We have eaten here two or three times now. The waiters dress formally. I like that.  They do not introduce themselves by name and say that they will be our "server." I like that too. When I am in a restaurant and a person wearing a black suit, white shirt and black bow-tie approaches my table and gives me a menu I don't need them to tell me they are a waiter. I do not care what their name is. This is a business transaction. The ambiance is unostentatious and friendly, seems to have old-world class. We had a reservation and were seated promptly. Our waiter knew the menu and was easily able to tell us about the specials, answering all our questions in a friendly way.  The bread was fresh. We started with a rich dark minestrone. Salad is also an option on the dinners. Then came a serving of the house pasta with a tasty meat sauce. Cheese is always offered and generously supplied. They serve good quality Parmesan with lots of flavor. I had sea bass with a lemon and caper sauce which was really good, lemony and savory at the same time. My entree came with a delicious serving of chard and some sliced potatoes which were perfect for getting up the yummy sauce.  My dining companions were all happy with what they ordered. The wine list is reasonably priced. One of my dining companions was my father. We were celebrating his 91st birthday. On the way out I noticed happy looking people drinking at the bar. As we left the owner asked us if all had gone well. This is a great place and we will be back.  According to my mother, who has lived in the Sunset for a long time, this place is what the area used to be like decades ago.
author: Willy F.

description: Came here for the bf's birthday on Friday.  We started with the escargots and they were delish.  We ordered the special which was roast leg of lamb and it was good.  The place was really loud and busy which was cool.  I had the hazelnut gelato for dessert.  Service was good too...I'd come back again.
author: Jade B.

description: i hope marcello's is still around when i'm, like, 70 and able to finally "fit in" with the rest of the crowd.  Old School in a very, very, very good way.
author: Trina D.

description:
The food was very delicious and very filling. My BF and I ordered from the deluxe dinners that come with soup or salad, pasta, and after meal drink of tea or coffee. The menu was kinda hard to decipher unless you're a major foodie or just know Italian food. I know I had the shrimp scampi on the deluxe menu but it was called something else. BF had the veal. They have like 4 or 5 veal dishes. Very tender but it was the first time I had veal so can't say much about it. As for the pasta, it was a penne was cook to perfection and had a really good meat sauce.  We also had two types of vegetables that came with the meal. I didn't really care for it much. The potatoes were really cute  when I first saw them but they were kinda dry on the edges and as Alton Brown on the Food Network says, "that's not good eats". They did serve bread with our meals. Not so sure about the butter being really, really good. They didn't skim on the bread either like most places do. So I like that especially since I'm usually really hungry by the time we sit down.

All in all, I think the regulars know exactly what they're getting and stick to the tried and true method. 

I would like to try the homemade ravioli now that I read another yelper's review and save room for some dessert...
author: Judy P.

description: Very old school Italian Restaurant. I've been coming here since I was a kid. The waiters are very friendly and are willing to tell a joke if you're listening. The minestrone soup is really good and so is the pasta. The entrees are filling and if you're not full by the time you leave this place, then you have an extremely big appetite. I'll keep coming back to this place as long as they keep serving up those traditional Italian dishes.
author: D J.

description: I really loved the feel of this place. The service was awesome and that's why I give them four stars. But the food was not so great which was very disappointing because I have heard great things. I had the Alfredo and it had no flavor plus the ling with clams tasted like the white wine had not been reduced and all I could taste was wine. I am going to go back and give it another try because the service was so good and of the great things Ive read on yelp. I really want to like this place.
author: Mike L.

description:
Marcellos is a throw back kind of place. Every time we go, we run into people we either know or have met before at Marcellos. 

The bar is a great place to start and have a nice cocktail. The Manhattans are perfect, and that's how we like 'em.

A few steps up into the dining areas and the dining fun begins. The atmosphere is cheery, friendly and efficient. The food is good basic Italian style. Although not spaghetti and meatball basic. They have great seafood and veal dishes and an always perfectly done NY Strip steak. I recommend the carbonara hands-down, best I've had.

We've had lots of family dinners here (25+ people) and everyone always gets a hot meal, served at the same time.

The tuxedo-clad wait-staff is the best and they do everything right, without being cheezy, they even sing "happy birthday".
author: nancy l.

description: I've never had a bad meal here.  I love the bar and I love the penguins.
author: Mieke V.

description:
You know the place is good whenyou run into a couple of north beach natives who've been around more years than I know they'd want to admit!!  I've been going there for years and have always insisted North Beach restaurants have nothing on this place.  But, when I see a couple of the boys in there raving that it's better than any restaurant in North Beach I sit up and take notice.

These guys tell it like it is... perhaps why I never ask them if my butt looks big in these pants... ah, but I digress.

If you're looking for consistently very good italian food - you've found it!
Ristorante Marcello's!
author: M M.

description: Best restaurant on Taraval.  Tony is a great waiter, very pleasant and when he's not too busy he's good for comic relief as well.  The few times i've been the food has been nice and comes out relatively fast.  Place is usually busy but they take reservations.
author: Joel S.

description: I've only been here once, but I definitely want to come back.  For one, I love restaurants that don't mind a throwback to days past, like male servers in ties and tails.  The interior is sparsely decorated, but clean and warm.  A long bar dominates one side of the long rectangular building , with tables lined up along the other wall.  Fare is traditional Italian, the fish is excellent, and it features a solid wine list.  Parking can be challenging because it's SF, but if you are in this neighborhood try it out.
author: Christopher V.

description: There is a door that opens onto 2100 Taraval.  The building has no windows and there doesn't appear to be any people going in or out....it says Marcello's on the outside...so it must be the place.  It's a cold and rainy Friday night at about 7:30.   The six of us walk in and the place was just packed to the rafters and as loud as can be...it was electric with people enjoying themselves.  Better wear your sun glasses and day makeup though...it's bright in there.  We were treated like old friends.  You will get a hearty meal, good service and at a reasonable price.  Marcello's is the kind of place where the food, while very good, seems to place second to atmosphere and old school charm.   Marcello himself was as nice and generous as could be.  Chances are, you won't be disappointed.
author: Larry S.

description: The food was decent but the service was a bit questionnable. This is definitely an 'old guard' Sunset establishment. The clientele wasn't particularly diverse and the vast majority looked as if they were over 50. Not complaining, mind you, just giving you a sense of the environment there. The food was...okay. Not great, not bad, just okay. I feel like it's not something I couldn't do at home with a solid recipe and a few minutes. Probably wouldn't go back but if you like 'homey' Italian food and the old school environment, this might be for you.
author: Bethany L.

description:
I love this restaurant because I feel like I have stepped back in time.  If Don Draper from Mad Men were Italian I would expect him to drop by and have a drink at the bar alone and stare into space.  The waiters all dress in tuxedos but customers feel right at home wearing sweaters sans jacket and coat.  Ok maybe Don Draper would feel a little over dressed but he would enjoy the food if he ate something rather than drink scotch.
What I also love about this place is that if you want to split an entree they do it agreeably  without a condescending attitude as some restaurants do.  If you bring your own wine they are happy to open it and even suggest decanting it for you.  They do charge a corkage but that is only fair  and I have no problem with that.  Also if you want to have more vegetables and forget the potatoes that is fine too.  Actually you can't do anything wrong here, the customer is always right.  A rare attitude with some restaurants.
The food is tasty, and served warm by a friendly waiter. 
If you like the 50's and 60's when things were easy,  comfortable, normal and uncomplicated you would love Marcellos.
author: Sally F.

description: Great neighborhood Italian. Taraval street car stops right in front.  My wife and i discovered pasta alla matriciana here - absolutely the best past we've ever had - and we LOVE pasta. Now we have to go whenever we get a craving!  Service is good/competent, wine list is varied and reasonable but has very limited by-the-glass offerings.
author: G T S.

description: Here is a great Parkside gem if you are in the mood for very high quality Italian food that is well executed and complimented by excellent service.   For starters, I showed up there with a party of five and without a reservation when the place was totally packed.  The staff was very friendly and made us feel comfortable waiting for a table to clear up.  The atmosphere is certainly old school, as you are inclined to find out in Parkside.  For me, that is a good sign, not like the over crowded low quality touristy joints up in North Beach.  Once we sat down, the real fun began.  Once you have picked a wine from their ample cellar, move on to making a selection of appetizers.  I highly recommend the avocado and shrimp salad.  If you are in a large group, pick a few more and enjoy the familial atmosphere.  Any selection of entree is sure to satisfy.  Marcello's is a little expensive, but the price is comfortably reflected in the quality and service that they provide.  Good for an unpretentious-yet-fancy romantic date, or a graduation dinner.
author: Mr. G.

description: Not amazing, but not bad.  So the basic vibe here is traditional Italian, with a whistling owner/matre d' patting backs and greeting long-time friends with grace, candor, and old time humor.  The food is good, and the bar is large and features more than a few fantastic regulars.  So why only three stars?  Well, there's a place called Golden Mirror, which is very close by, and does the exact same experience, but better.  You won't have a bad meal here (the veal is as tender as you could ever hope for), and, in case you were worried, I won't fault you for dining here, so you got that going for you.  But, basically, this falls squarely between Villa d'Este (on the low end) and Golden Mirror (high end) in terms of West/SouthWest SF old school Italian eateries.  But if you are in the area and are entertaining folk (or in-law folks), this will calm their fears that every SF restaurant is like Emmy's.
author: Steve G.

description: all about the atmosphere. if you like the scene at house of prime rib you'll enjoy it hear as well.
author: carl p.

description: i hope no one from this restaurant has connections to the mafia (good fellas/casino style)~vee was in the mood for italian & we were in the avenues since watered down olive garden was crowded....the scene was nice~it was packed...yes it seemed like we were the youngest ones there...so i was in the mood for seafood~now when i think of seafood @ an italian joint~i think of pasta & my choice of clams/shrimp/sum type of fish....maybe my thinkin of seafood pasta is very americanized & not authentic italian....but what i got was sumthin i couldve made as a fri nite tv dinner =x....my salad wit vinegrette dressing was sooo unfresh & tasted old...three slices of marinated fish with seasoning/lemon....grilled cucumber on the side...slices of steamed potato slices...& the red pasta served b4 my meal look like chef boyardee....im never coming back here~nothin worse than goin home with eating a horrid meal & wondering what couldve been~one star for our waiter chuggin a beer in the back while we were waiting for our food & smelling like a chimney when taking our order/served our food
author: elmer d.
